author: {'steamid': '76561198293909829', 'num_games_owned': 7682, 'num_reviews': 461, 'playtime_forever': 1700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1373, 'playtime_at_review': 1700, 'last_played': 1711371139}
review:
[b]Carmageddon Max Pack[/b] offers a nostalgic trip back to the chaotic and over-the-top world of vehicular mayhem. While the visuals may be outdated by today's standards, the gameplay remains as fun and exhilarating as ever. 

With its unique blend of racing, destruction, and dark humour, Carmageddon Max Pack provides hours of entertainment for those looking to unleash their inner daredevil. If you can overlook the dated graphics, this classic title is a wild ride that is sure to bring back fond memories of the golden age of arcade racing games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967449126', 'num_games_owned': 2389, 'num_reviews': 366, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1708918996}
review:
I loved Camageddon when I was a kid and this came out but I can't recommend this version today. The insanity of running over pedestrians is still there but beyond the nostalgia this isn't a particularly good version.

First, the game opens in DOSBox and it's in something like 320p. You have to open a config file outside of the game to raise the resolution. Fine, whatever. I can get past that as a one time set up. You alt-tab once? Too bad, black screen until you close the game and boot it back up. The music is great, when the audio plays. I don't know what seems to trigger for all the audio to cut off but it randomly does and it will not go back on until you guessed it, shut the game down and relaunch it. Steam says I played the game for 40 minutes. Of that time, my sound completely shut off 4 times and I had to restart the game 3 times because everything went black from alt-tabbing.

Oh, and when everything does decide to work, you can't rebind half the controls! There's no native controller support. The default keys are the number pad 8, 4, 6, 2. I don't get why 2 is brake/reverse instead of 5 which would feel at least semi natural. You can only seem to rebind half the keys, you can't use WASD to drive. 

The physics are obviously going to be terrible by today's standards. I'm probably looking at it through nostalgia glasses and maybe it was this bad back in the day but it just feels awful to drive in this game today. You have to slow down way too much to make any turn. While turning with any kind of speed, you will never be lucky enough to find that threshold between barely turning at all or completely spinning out into a full 360. 

I don't know if it's this particular version of Camageddon or if it's the game itself. But after the novelty of running over pedestrians or cows to add time to the clock, when you're lucky enough to not have to shut the game down due to bugs, you're still left with a frustrating driving experience. It's a real shame to not recommend Carmageddon because it is such a classic to me but this just really isn't worth it unless they at least patch the bugs. Judging that it's almost a 30 year old game, I just know that's never going to happen.

author: {'steamid': '76561199152101190', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1668154818}
review:
This game is very special on a personal level. it was the first game I've ever played as a kid in the late 90s and it defined not only my love for video games but also got me into metal since then. I can't even recall how many times I replayed it since then and I still have a lot of fun every time. 

It's bloody, explosive, badass. Simple and to the point, and it achieves its purpose very well. The characters and vehicles are badass and the tracks are fun. It's the kind of straightforward unhinged fun that we don't find very often nowadays.

Together with Twisted Metal and Vigilante 8 it completes what I call the holy trinity of my childhood's racing games and I will probably replay it from time to time for years to come still!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021434924', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1697203612}
review:
The mobile version is far better than this outdated garbage.
No source ports. Tried modernizing the game with a so called special edition you simply drag and drop and play. it won't run though. Drag and drop and it should run. Right?
Apparently not!!
Too bad the mobile version lacks the splat pack. What a shame. If video game preservation is so important then this game deserves to be modernized on PC as well with all the modifications they did with the mobile version.
But it wouldn't be a problem if stupid dosbox didn't use the s key as a mute function.
All I know is that I'd rather overall play the mobile version even though it lacks the splat pack.  I can't believe there has to be a catch on both ends for on one hand playing the mobile version is cleaner and more optimized but on the other you have the PC version where it's the only way to play the splat pack. Why Stainless didn't the splat pack ever get put out on mobile? Would it have been redundant? The levels are undoubtedly more imaginative and plainly different than the base game so basically brushing off the expansion is a disservice to this classic game.
And it is sad how under the radar this game feels. Like seriously before GTAIII you had this. THIS! The first two GTA's hold no candle to this classic that showed you a glimpse into what GTAIII would become. The fact that you could mow down swathes of pedestrians in a 3D game in 1997 should have blown minds. Must have had bad marketing because this game should still be soaring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168758718', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1705773495}
review:
I am super pissed. Love the game, but cannot accept the fact that this 26 year old game which I ran perfectly fine back in the day on a 166MHz 16MB machine now is barely playable on a six-core 3.9 GHz 16 gb RAM with a 4gb graphics card machine. I installed the fan-made restoration pack however still is not right and even it was - that is a fan-made patch and has nothing to do with Steam (and GOG for that matter) releasing a half-assed version and charging for it. Can't get over the fact there is a free Android port that works flawlessly at 60 fps on a phone but we cannot get a commercial version running on a modern PC "out of the box". Pathetic. Works OK with dgvoodoo's wrapper but that's not the point.

Another edit: the 12 hours spent according to this review is 12 hours spent in trying to make this release work. Nothing more to add.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989766649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1621516214}
review:
You drive around in a car and do laps, hit other cars, run over pedestrians or a combination of all three.. It boils down to a high octane mixture of WWE and Mad Max with an added dose of the 90s ‚Äúedgy‚Äù tastelessness. Carmageddon is truly a child of its time and therein lies part of its problems. It is more or less a hassle to optimize on modern rigs, Dosbox works somewhat but honestly I have had a plethora of performance issues so your mileage may vary, alot.. The gameplay in itself is fine for what it is but the plethora of crashes and bugs is honestly the main thing that keeps me from returning.

Be warned. Only get it if you love fixing broken things, be it cars or games..

author: {'steamid': '76561198414038144', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1710455367}
review:
Carmageddon,un nome che potrebbe invogliare gli arabi a ribombardare gli Stati Uniti con un Boeing 747 e un caccia alieno,ma √® il nome di uno dei giochi probabilmente pi√π violenti mai creati nella storia.
Partiamo dal fatto che non abbia una storia,√® semplicemente un riferimento ad Anno 2000 - La corsa della morte,con la presenza di Sylvester Stallone,quindi non c √® molto da aggiungere a riguardo.
Il gameplay √® strutturato come un semplice gioco di corse qualsiasi,solo che invece di correre dovrete anche ammazzare gente,raccogliere potenziamenti in giro per la mappa e riparare ed aggiornare la vostra macchina in vari tipi,come paraurti e scudo.
La grafica....
....
ODDIO,la grafica,pur essendo un gioco del 1997 √® davvero ricca di dettagli.
Molto gore e molto realistica specialmente quando le persone vengono spappolate e volano per aria,tralatro non sono presenti soltanto le persone ma anche gli animali,e qu√† animalisti state zitti e rovesciatevi ai testimoni di Geova con il vostro perbenismo.
Le auto,non le ho contate ma saranno pi√π di 20 nel gioco,ognuna ispirata ad un modello reale e caratteristica in ogni forma e dimensione.
Poi per l'uso di attori veri per la rappresentazione dei personaggi la trovo una buonissima idea,dato che sono stati realizzati abbastanza bene,con un greenscreen e vi dir√≤,le botte che prendiamo nel gioco in realt√† le prendono anche gli attori dal vivo,quindi sono molto credibili le loro espressioni sul volto.
Il gioco ancora non l'ho finito,quindi dopo questa recensione mi spiccer√≤ e andr√≤ a completare questa opera d'arte ma posso solo dirvi che alla lunga il gioco potrebbe stancarvi ma vi far√† divertire molto anche durante i momenti di noia.
Unica critica che faccio √® che ogni volta che esco dal desktop il gioco diventer√† nero ma non preoccupatevi,basta uscire due volte dal desktop ovvero:Appena accade la prima volta,uscite la prima,rientrate nel gioco e se vedete ancora nero,rientrate ancora una volta ed il gioco √® fatto.
Da prendere in offerta quando costa meno di 5 euro poich√® 8 euro √® un prezzo troppo alto per un gioco d'epoca e tralatro,un altra cosa che rode il culo a me √® che il gioco non sia una versione Windows ma una versione emulata su Dosbox ma non mi importa alla fine,mi piace giocare con la tastiera.
Tralatro mi rode il culo che questo gioco sia stato censurato e visionato da noi italiani dal parlamento italiano per rimuovere il sangue e altri contenuti dal gioco,davvero andate all'inferno e giudicate il vostro moralismo da qualche altra parte per favore.
Recensir√≤ il secondo capitolo quando mi capiter√†,ma per ora concludo questa recensione sanguinosa e buona fortuna,piloti carneficiosi.
8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971719465', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1689955852}
review: This game is in my top three of all time. I played it back in 1998 on my mom's Cyrix II 233Mhz PC with only integrated graphics. It was a blast and I played it for years. Seeing it back now on modern PCs, Android, and iOS is awesome. If you haven't tried this game, you really should give it a shot, it's cheap, usually goes on sale for like $3 sometimes. It's dumb fun and the physics and vehicle mechanics are still better than some of the games released today.

review:
√â um bom jogo. Gostava bastante de jogar quando mais novo, e at√© hoje ainda gosto. Possu√≠ uma boa variedade de carros (que vai se conquistando ao decorrer das corridas), mapas e a trilha sonora tamb√©m √© excelente! 

Minhas reclama√ß√µes do jogo em si v√£o apenas para a falta de suporte de controle e nem todos os bot√µes serem configur√°veis (d√° pra contornar esse problema usando um programinha externo). Em quesito dessa vers√£o da Steam, a reclama√ß√£o fica para a maneira que ela roda, at√© mesmo em PCs high-end. Rodando no modo 3Dfx, o framerate √© maior, entretanto o jogo √© mais inst√°vel, com algumas falhas no sons, gr√°ficos e at√© travamentos ao pausar √†s vezes. Em contrapartida, rodando no modo Software, o framerate √© mais baixo, por√©m n√£o tem os problemas citados acima do modo 3Dfx.

Enfim, com minha experi√™ncia at√© o momento digo que est√° jog√°vel, mas n√£o totalmente est√°vel. Fique ciente destes problemas e possua um PC razoavelmente bom, mesmo que o jogo seja de 1997. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069330773', 'num_games_owned': 636, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1683658944}
review:
It's a great game early on in the first half of the levels, unlocking cars is random. The later levels are such a hassle with all the ramps and so MANY LAPS oh my god and don't even think of trying to destroy everyone when you have to go looking for them for minutes. The controls are utter garbage too. When you want to play a classic game though this is sadly what you have to go through.

The core of this game is great, and a fun idea, but it get's dragged out so poorly.  I imagine this was way better back in the day. Didn't age well, but I respect it if you can get past all the jank of a DOS era game then you'll be fine just be prepared to suffer through bits of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352828985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1683470450}
review:
The car drives like a tank on ice, at every turn you'll take the wrong trajectory, at every ramp you'll overturn for no apparent reason. I couldn't mute the music in any way (it's not loud anyway, but the option doesn't work, removing the files didn't work for me, replacing them with silent files of the same format didn't work either). Controls suck, no keybinding, no WASD, just a pre-selection of awkward configurations. If you use alt-tab sometimes strange things happen, like all the writings disappearing.

So... why the positive rating and my full support? Because it's friggin Carmageddon, that's why. If you played it in the 90s you know exactly what I mean and I think you would agree.

For everyone else, if they're not looking for an experience that clearly shows its age, perhaps it's best to move on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250049674', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 3381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3381, 'last_played': 1682781056}
review: Was quite a fun game. The freedom you have as to how you approach races feels really good and you have the opportunity to actually explore the map and find hidden spots, without having too worry that you're gonna fall behind. I played on the hardest difficulty, which was indeed quite a challenge, but the lower difficulties are a lot more relaxed and can also be a very chill game (depends what you want). However, I did have some crashes, which at times were rather discouraging and would be nice if they released an update fixing it. I also played the original DOSbox version, because I could run it windowed mode, but the 3dfx version works fine as well, as long as you don't tab other cause you're sure ain't tabbing back in. But if you don't mind not tabbing out the 3dfx version actually looks much better and felt more immersive (partly because of the fullscreen). Also the game is pretty much 2 in 1 (Max Pack and Splat Pack) and found Max Pack more difficult and it had more races, but I'd recommend playing it first, because while Splat Pack was easier and shorter, its last level just felt like the perfect awesome conclusion to the combined game. All in all it was a pretty neat game, just needs some fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059391379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1503587412}
review:
The first Carmageddon was my first PC game I've played in PC Caves back in the day. This is why Carmageddon is my fav racing game at all times.
Carmageddon Max Pack was a game that many of us grew up playing, and for good reason. The game was a masterpiece of vehicular combat, featuring a huge variety of cars, weapons, and environments to explore.

Playing Carmageddon Max Pack was a rush like no other. The feeling of slamming into an opponent at high speed, sending them careening off the road and into a wall, was incredibly satisfying. And the game's wide range of weapons, from chainsaws to machine guns, made sure that the carnage never got old.

But perhaps the most memorable aspect of Carmageddon Max Pack was its environments. Whether you were racing through a city, a suburban neighborhood, or a desert wasteland, each level was full of secrets to uncover and obstacles to overcome. And with the game's open-world design, you were free to explore to your heart's content, discovering hidden areas and power-ups that could give you an edge in battle.

The graphics and sound design in Carmageddon Max Pack were also top-notch, with impressive visuals and a soundtrack that perfectly captured the game's frenzied atmosphere.

Looking back on it now, playing Carmageddon Max Pack feels like a trip down memory lane. It's a game that reminds us of a simpler time, when we could spend hours on end racing, battling, and exploring without a care in the world. If you're feeling nostalgic for the games of your childhood, Carmageddon Max Pack is a must-play.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994002775', 'num_games_owned': 6538, 'num_reviews': 1438, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1676331617}
review:
Ah... Carmageddon, I think many fans of this franchise got interested in the game through many visits to a friend or cousin who had the game on a pre 2000s windows computer.

The game also works on a steam deck, although I found the framerates to be surprisingly lower than expected at times, but you can watch a snippet of gameplay here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gKokKyonMqY

Where pedestrians just can't walk away from your incoming vehicle fast enough and cows shit blood.
Welcome to the chaotic and murderous world of Carmageddon, where your opponents are a bunch of lunatics and killing machines, and secretly you are too during the events of this game.

You gain time by mowing the locals or hitting vehicles, so do as you please! 
Combining insane power-ups, surreal environments and different ways to win, the game guarantees endless hours of violent and hilarious entertainment.

Max Damage features 30 vehicles and ten environments. The game also includes a Career Mode, an Action Replay Mode and a multiplayer mode with four types of events, don't ask me how many races there are to do because there really are a lot of them, and a good thing, this is a game that never gets boring!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001477300', 'num_games_owned': 2057, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2129, 'last_played': 1622967406}
review:
Absolute mega classic. Have fun driving around in awesome cars, driving over pedestrians and trying to ram your opponents to death.

The enemy AI is brainless, but it doesn't really need to be any more than that. The pure random carnage is endlessly entertaining.

You can win a stage in 3 different ways:
Kill all pedestrians: These are usually in the hundreds and takes quite a time to achieve if you don't use the electric beam car.
Finish the race: The most boring way to win. Opponents don't even try to race, and afaik it's not even possible to lose by an opponent finishing.
Kill all your opponents: The proper way to play.

The game makes use of teleporting your opponents around you at high speed when you're not looking, and this causes so much random fun carnage of opponents just flying around and randomly ramming things. Some of the most entertaining things I've ever experienced.

Later in the game, especially in the Splat Pack expansion that is included in the game, do require you to replay levels quite a lot in order to progress in the game. This is pretty much my only complaint about the game. But considering how fun it is, I could replay this game to no end anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198449661826', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1672379349}
review:
Carmageddon: The Racing Game for the Chemically Imbalanced.

Back in 1997, Stainless Games predicted how the world would look like in 2026: fatal toxins will pollute the earth's atmosphere spreading sickness among the population, multinational corporations will turn the oceans into yellow acid pools, and living in a big city will be a synonymous of a violent death.

A dystopian world indeed, and Stainless Games came up with a way to interact with this world: annihilate everything.

To kill for the sake of killing, men, women, children, grannies, pregnants, cattle, sheep, penguins, cops, prostitutes, miners and divers, their guts must see the sunlight, all methodically slaughtered, in the most creative way.

Because your goal in this new earth is to turn it into a vast altar upon which all that is living must be sacrificed without end, without measure, without pause, until the consummation of things, until evil is extinct, until the death of death.

The bad part is that this version unlike an Android port published some years back, hasn't been remastered. So you'll have to stick with DOSBox to run it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344389941', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1672254550}
review:
[h1]PROS[/h1]

-Running over people and cows is obviously fun.

-90‚Äôs graphics.

-90‚Äôs metal music. I swear one of the guitar rifts is taken straight out of the Johnny Cage vs Scorpion fight from the 1995 Mortal Kombat movie, big if true.

-FMV videos of the drivers‚Äô faces while driving is charming as fuck.

-Die Anna is an absolute QT, and I love most of her FMV face reactions while driving. Unfortunate side note: whenever you flip your car over the FMV of Die Anna does that weird Jenna Ortega Wednesday Addams sperg lord face (you know the gif), and it takes me out of the 90‚Äôs.

[h1]CONS[/h1]

-The controls are very very very sloppy. You can‚Äôt just hold down RT and wiggle the left analog stick, you will die, so you need to sort of just tap the gas here and there. And OF COURSE you will need to JoyToKey yourself a proper controller scheme. 

-The game can crash on you.

[h1]OVERALL THOUGHTS[/h1]

90‚Äôs Charm vs Sloppy Controls‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶I am going to recommend this game, but be warned, it will be extremely painful‚Ä¶..FOR YOU!! DEEP DISCOUNT ONLY.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184596858', 'num_games_owned': 3086, 'num_reviews': 918, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1666460193}
review:
Carmageddon is no ordinary car racing game, it's not about who crosses the finish line in 1st place. Carmageddon is about accumulating as many points as you can until you conclude one of the objectives (before the time ends): By wasting all of your opponents, killing everyone, or crossing all the checkpoints.

This version includes two editions: Max Pack and Splat Pack, and at the start you can even pick between the 3DFX version or the normal version. Although this game runs in DOSBox (it brings some issues, such as not being able to Alt + Tab without bugging the game), there's not much else to complain about. Thanks to nGlide, you can also run the game in high resolutions!

The game is really fun, and violent, with cool car designs, and with an awesome soundtrack! Undoubtedly, a timeless classic!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965828391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1669697160}
review: I fired this old gem up for nostalgia's sake.  went to the control settings and went "oh... yeah... i remember how bad this was now..."  Go ahead, try to change the controls to something that makes sense.  "Up, Down, Left, Right..." nope.... "W,S,A,D?" Nope... okay, let me get my controller.. Calibrate and... oh, it's never calibrated well enough to change your controls.  the moment you select the control you want to chage it's now "joy1 up."  What's the solution, go into the game files and find the keymap and change it my dang-self with text editor. But why can't the company who i payed money for the game do this? I mean i did it in 5 minutes, why wouldn't the people trying to make money off this game spend MINUTES adding modern sensibility into this game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198043314158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1678762258}
review:
SVGA car crashing and ped crushing galore!
If you watched Death Race or any demolition derby stuff on tape growing up, and thought "hey I want to do that and crush pixelated people too!" this is the game for you.

+Pros
+Retro graphics
+3dfx mode for those who want a smoother look!
+Fear factory made some of the music

~Neutrals
~Dosbox is the emulator of this version, and this version always starts in 640x480. My modern monitors really don't like 640x480, or anything below 720p. This can be altered by changing video settings using one of the community guides.

-Cons
-Not much soundtrack, and the limited amount of music gets old fast.
-Old graphics. Sometimes, it just looks like dog shit.
-Control schemes in this game are absolutely bizarro, and some of the buttons are hard coded for functions, so you can't use WASD without altering game files. That's a huge bummer. I found the best control scheme for the driving buttons is to use HOME for gas END for brake DELETE for turn left and PAGEDOWN for turn right.
-3DFX Support is not user friendly in the Windows 10 era to get running. I installed nGlide and followed an offsite tutorial for nGlide in DOSBox. For someone who tinkers with modding or whatever, it's not a huge deal. But for someone who is new to retro PC gaming, and knows nothing about anything, it would be a massive stretch to learn how to do everything needed to get the best graphics out of this version of the game.
-My Ryzen 5700g will not run this in DOSBox at full speed with maximum graphics settings enabled. I think it might be a limitation of DOSBox, but that was worth mentioning because the 5700g isn't exactly a cheap or underpowered part. Turning down some of the settings GREATLY improves frame pacing and allows me to run this on an older zotac zbox with a i5 5200u and gtx960, so I really think its a DOSBox limitation somewhere.
-Sound crackling is absurdly common in this game. I never played the original on retro hardware, so I dont know if that was just the way it was or if the crackling was introduced in this version, but I can't find any useful information online to fix the crackling. It only appears when multiple cars are near each other, or if the same sound effects are overlapping, but it is extremely distracting at times.

6.9/10, but its just barely not a 7. Play Carmageddon 2, it is much better in every way. If it had more music, it would be a 7.

review: Nie wiem dok≈Çadnie co mnie ciƒÖgnie do serii "Carmageddon". Ale co≈õ musi w niej byƒá skoro w zwyk≈Çej grze DOS'owej mam nabite (w chwili pisania recenzji) ponad 300h. Mo≈ºe odej≈õcie od regu≈Ç? Zamiast ≈õcigania siƒô kto pierwszy dojedzie do mety, mo≈ºna sobie zjechaƒá na pobocze i wprasowaƒá w ziemiƒô cywili. W≈Ça≈õciwie nie mo≈ºna tylko trzeba, inaczej dogoni nas licznik czasu i po ptokach. Licznik jest tutaj naszym jedyny wrogiem, bo nie da siƒô tu zginƒÖƒá. √ìw licznik mo≈ºna nabiƒá rozje≈ºd≈ºaniem przechodni√≥w, rozbijaniem siƒô o wrog√≥w czy zbieraniem beczek dajƒÖcych nam premiƒô do czasu. Ka≈ºdƒÖ trasƒô mo≈ºna zwyciƒô≈ºyƒá na trzy sposoby: Naj≈Çatwiej rozbiƒá wszystkich wrog√≥w w drobny py≈Ç, trochƒô trudniej (i nudniej) przejechaƒá wszystkie trasy lub najtrudniej - rozjechaƒá wszystkich setek pieszy na ca≈Çej mapie. Dziƒôki temu ostatniemu nagradzani jeste≈õmy dodatkowymi kredytami. √ìw kredyty mo≈ºna wydaƒá na ulepszenie do maksimum naszego pojazdu. Nastƒôpne trasy mo≈ºna odblokowaƒá nie ko≈ÑczƒÖc ich, a pozycjƒÖ w rankingu od 100 do 1. Kiedy dana trasa do odblokowania potrzebuje pozycji w rankingu np. 82 a my mamy 83, potrzeba ponownie przej≈õƒá poprzednie trasy i w ten spos√≥b pozycjƒô w rankingu sobie zmniejszyƒá. Warto te≈º wspomnieƒá o ≈õcie≈ºce d≈∫wiƒôkowej, kt√≥ra wed≈Çug mnie jest genialna. W Carmageddon'ie pos≈Çuchaƒá mo≈ºemy zespo≈Çu "Fear Factory", kt√≥rego dziƒôki tej grze pozna≈Çem i ich albumu "Demanufacture". Opr√≥cz nich jest tak≈ºe genialny kompozytor Lee Groves. Edycja Max Pack tej gry zawiera tak≈ºe oficjalny dodatek "Splat Pack" na kt√≥rego nie mia≈Çem czasu, wiƒôc siƒô nie wypowiem. Grƒô uko≈Ñczy≈Çem ca≈ÇƒÖ w wersji DOS'owej (wed≈Çug mnie lepszy klimat), na najtrudniejszym poziomie trudno≈õci i starajƒÖc siƒô przej≈õƒá wszystkie trasy eliminujƒÖc przechodni√≥w (Protip: przy eliminowaniu wszystkich setek pieszy warto wyposa≈ºyƒá siƒô w power-up z jednej z beczek kt√≥ry pokazuje nam ich po≈Ço≈ºenie na ca≈Çej mapie, inaczej bliskie niemo≈ºliwemu jest rozjechanie wszystkich pieszy). Grƒô r√≥wnie≈º mo≈ºna odpaliƒá w wersji 3DFX, co poprawia grafikƒô dostosowujƒÖc siƒô do dzisiejszych rozdzielczo≈õci. Warto te≈º wspomnieƒá o ma≈Ço znanej funkcji - wci≈õniƒôcie przycisku "Z" na klawiaturze na poczƒÖtku trasy zanim narrator doliczy do zera, pozwoli zlikwidowaƒá czekanie i wyprzedziƒá wrog√≥w, jednak zostanie na≈Ço≈ºona na nas grzywna w wysoko≈õci 1000 kredyt√≥w za bycie "Bad boy'em". Intro tej gry na poczƒÖtku jest w h√≥i epickie i daje przedsmak tego co nas czeka. Prawie 330 godzin zabawy za 9z≈Ç na przecenie to prawie jak za darmo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081588794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1645434757}
review:
A little austere, but almost as good as I remembered it!

Under 3 bucks for both Carmageddon 1 and the crazy Splat Pack was too good to pass up. I followed the guides "Controls - using arrow keys instead" and "Quick tweak guide to SVGA software mode + higher res 3dfx mode", ran in 3DFX mode, and was back having  a good time, remembering the crazy hidden areas (toxic waste facility near a ski resort!). The car physics is weird but the destruction is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005610787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2449, 'last_played': 1709522323}
review:
Although the game is repetitive overall, I enjoy the crap out of this game!! I can't seem to get enough of the demo derby action! A classic working well in a modern machine makes the game really satisfying to continue playing instead of the constant crashes at the first track on old DOS.

The AI can really be jerks, enough to push your buttons and go nuclear over them. What compensated the nuisance, though, was burning through the ranks in the game.
I noticed that the cars that are earned seemed to mean to be useful in certain ranks rather than going for just one car throughout the game. In the highest ranks, it was satisfying to total police rams more than the opponents in the game.

This is definitely worth the purchase!! It made Christmas several years ago so awesome to play when snow really fell. I became so satisfied with the purchase as a result.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987014665', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1984, 'last_played': 1693932337}
review:
I remember playing this game as a kid/teenager. One of the best back then in 1997 and still one of the best in 2021. You just cannot describe how much fun this game delivers. After 24 years... I have completed it for the first time. 32 hours of amazing fun and guess what?

After 32 hours of amazing pure gaming fun you get tons of after-game bonuses you can have fun with all over again¬¨!! I wanted to skip straight to Carmageddon 2 after this but you just cannot... There is so much to unblock yet and so many things you can play with.

If you could marry games. This one would be my WIFE.

- amazing cars
- amazing humour
- awesome physics
- each car has its own advantages and disadvantages
- you can get/unblock every single car you see by playing
- super fun open world racing tracks
- how often do you pull your handbrake to slide your car in order smash as many as possible people in one go!? I mean this is just pure 90s godness.
- the fun never ends...
- going top speed for a head-on crash just never gets boring
- bigger the car = bigger the weight = send them opponents to another realm with that crash you've just delivered
- power ups
- upgrades/tuning
- cool music


It is not just nostalgia... It is what all games should be about = pure fun and joy. It is so ironic that in 2021 where we have so many so-called amazing next gen games they almost all fail to deliver... 

Try it. You will not regret it. I cannot wait to play all other carmageddon games after this one...

This game is a part of me and I am so damn proud of the fact that it has been with me since my early days/

When all the world falls apart... this game holds it together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050237511', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1633907738}
review:
Es una mezcla entre carrera por tiempo y battle royale de autos chocadores. Lo novedoso es que hay gente y animales dando vuelta por el mapa que pod√©s llevarte puestos de forma sangrienta y eso te suma plata y tiempo. Algo llamativo es que te pod√©s reparar en el medio de la carrera mientras corr√©s, pero te cuesta dinero. Los precios son elevados, pero salvan las papas del fuego. El humor loco que tiene le da un toque (en la descripci√≥n del juego leete el primer p√°rrafo donde dice "HISTORY"). Vas ganando plata por carreras y desbloqueando autos para comprarlos y mejorarlos, cada uno con sus stats. 
Es una emulaci√≥n de la versi√≥n de MS-DOS. Los controles son s√≥lo con teclado (y no se pueden cambiar porque est√°n mal emulados). Tiene su lugar en el sal√≥n de la fama y del recuerdo pero ya no da para recomendarlo. 
El precio de AR$ 130 me parece bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4500, 'num_reviews': 1010, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1405403484}
review:
Carmageddon is one of my favorite games ever. I have so many fond memories of it, it was so much fun. Back in 1997 it was considered very controversial because of its violent nature (which was exaggerated, even back then). Let‚Äôs take a more in-depth look if you ever want to give it a try.

The concept of Carmageddon is basically quite simple: it‚Äôs like a racing game, but also not really, because there are multiple ways to get through a level or race.
You start each level in a big open world (back then at least) where you can go wherever you like right after you‚Äôve started a race (and you can cheat a little and press a button to start driving before the announcer is done counting down‚Ä¶ and run him over). Among the levels are a street, mountain area and an area with a beach.
Anyway, you can either: finish the race by racing laps, killing of all of the pedestrians in a level (which is time consuming) or destroy all of your opponents. And the fun really starts with these last two choices.
The vehicles in this game are not just your regular vehicles, no sir, for example; they consist of a hearse, a tow truck and a monster truck, all with their own deadly attachments ((saw)blade, spikes, et cetera). And they‚Äôre driven by people like O.J. Stimpson. Pure madness. And fun.
These cars can be destroyed. Annihilated. Pulverized. Anything. They‚Äôre completely destructible and for me that was even more fun than running over pedestrians (which resulted in gore, and points earned). But almost always it was a bit of both.
Driving at an opponent at full speed, seeing parts of the car fly off or the car itself get dented is immensely satisfying.
At different times wrecked (‚ÄòWasted!‚Äô) cars can also be stolen, just by destroying them. But that depends on the level itself and the car. I think all of them could be stolen (and naturally driven) by the end of the game, including an extremely overpowered cop car (Squad Car) that would take ages to even take down. But by then you should already have (almost) finished the game.
You start the game at Rank 99 and then you climb the ladder by finishing races. I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs random or not; I never found out how to climb up to a specific rank back in the day.
Power-ups are also scattered through the levels in different kind of colored containers. These contain all sorts of zany power-ups like pedestrians being glued to the ground, getting zapped by electricity shot out of your car or turning your car into granite. They always spawn at the same place, they‚Äôre not randomized.
Also, it didn‚Äôt actually add anything to the gameplay - but it did add to the atmosphere - but I just want to mention the Pratcam. A camera in the upper left corner that showed Max Damage or Die Anna reacting to your driving skills. Fun times!

This pack also contains the Splat Pack DLC which was a separate add-on back in the days, containing more levels, power-ups and cars, if I remember correctly. So good value all in all.

Graphics wise Carmageddon was insanely pretty, with nicely detailed 3D vehicles that had destructible physics unlike any game I‚Äôve ever played back in those days. The levels were large and had clear textures. The pedestrians were actually 2D sprites, made with different angles, and this is obviously logical since there can be hundreds of pedestrians in a level and PCs weren‚Äôt as powerful back then.
I think the game had heavy metal kind of music in it. The sound effects consisted of lifelike, but higher pitched screams for pedestrians and metal clashing into metal for the cars. It was quite realistic in a game-y sort of way.

Carmageddon still is to this day a great game, with no other games quite like it. Sure, it‚Äôs dated by now, but give it a try if you like old school games and I can assure you you‚Äôll have a good time with it.

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197983225082', 'num_games_owned': 864, 'num_reviews': 321, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1624603951}
review:
This is a hard game to recommend when the android works and looks so much better. The android is also free. If you have a android tablet try carmageddon. Like I say it looks better then this version and runs better no work involved. This version requires work from the user to get it running correctly. First issue no joystick support so your going to need something like joy2key program that allows you to use a joystick with this game that does not support joysticks.  The other issue terrible in game music that cannot be turned off in game. Their is a solution but it again requires work from the user. 

Once you have put in the work to get these problems fixed the game can be fun. However like I say the android version just works and looks better without having the user do anything to get it to run great and its Free. I enjoy the game on android and not on the PC. Its to much work. If your going to get one of these get the newest version or Carmageddon 2 on GOG as its currently on sale for under 3 dollars and its a lot easier to get working correctly.

review: Best Old School game for total carnage. It's like and older version of Most Wanted, you race a list of 100 different maps and as you progress you unlock new cars and stronger armour for your vehicle. You can win a race buy destroying all your opponents or finishing all the laps. You gain extra time by hitting into your opponents or killing them/pedestrians. It is a game from 1997 so don't expect RTX graphics. Still a GEM OF A GAME. If you like killing and demolishing of opponents give this a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042259317', 'num_games_owned': 4316, 'num_reviews': 414, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1621151243}
review:
How this janky mess of a old game gets so many positive reviews is beyond me. I'm sure it was fine on its proper native hardware, but trying to play it in modern times is a headache and even when I'm in it, I'm not convinced it is such a great game. More a game loved by nostalgia for its zaniness.

This feels like it really needs a "source port" treatment like the Doom/Quake games to make them more playable on modern hardware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198863687366', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1903, 'last_played': 1662895504}
review:
What a classic! 
I personally think this is the best game of the Carmageddon series. Even tho I do realy enjoy playing the new version of the game from 2016: Carmageddon Max Damage/Reincarnation. 
This game kinda gives the same vibe as the older Doom games. And I realy love that kind of game styling. 
Which is actually pretty funny when you think about it. Because this game is actually from 1997. the time that games were still in development. A bit about the "Maim of the game" as they call it in the game. 
You play either as Max Damage, in his Red eagle or as Die Anna, in her Yellow hawk. I chose Max, because he is kinda the face of the game. the first track you'l be playing on is Maim street. A map which takes place in a city with a big football stadium, with ofcourse, 2 football teams you can run over with your four-wheeled killing machine. killing all pedestrians is also 1 of the 3 options of completing a game. But this will take lots of time finding all peds on the map. Running over peds is also a way of getting extra time on your timer. When the timer hits zero, you lose the game. the 2nd option of completing the game is by destroying/killing the other drivers in the race. Which is mostly the best way of completing a game. the game includes big variety of cars. my favorite enemy car is the Stiffshifter. Which is driven by the brothers Grimm. the 3rd option you can choose from is by completing all maps, Which is'nt that fun to do, because the other drivers arent realy trying to "Race" you. And I also dont think an opponent can realy win the race. this is different in the new version of the game.  

If you are into Old/Retro, Doom-styled games, Which includes mad max- like vehicles, weird and insane drivers, a splash of blood, humor, and motor oil. than this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042433092', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34963, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 223, 'playtime_at_review': 1894, 'last_played': 1712103354}
review: DOS Box running Carmageddon is somewhat buggy. But there are workarounds if you're patient. The main problem is hitting Esc, which is an important function, may black out the game or other oddities. Just Alt-Tab into Steam and back again, once or twice or thrice, and eventually the interface will return to normal. Also, DOS Box takes a long, boring time to quit. It will eventually, so be patient. All in all, this is a brilliant game that I love and will forever love for its total absurdity and joy of mangling and murdering, virtually. It's fun. Be sure to grab the cheats and player created new cars. Max Pack is all new scenarios and cars beyond regular Carmageddon. The pedestrians are 2D, but you won't care, it's so well done.

author: {'steamid': '76561199146572279', 'num_games_owned': 7, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1616179694}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971440424', 'num_games_owned': 1806, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1665243370}
review:
You might need to tweak the resolutions a bit and get used to the controls but after you do, it's pure heaven. 

Carmageddon is a game about crashing into cars, crashing into people and if you're bored actually finishing the race. Wash, rinse, repeat. A very simple formula but super effective. 

Carmageddon is the equivalent of one of those squeezy stressballs with the pop-out eyes. It's also the only unofficial video game adaptation of the cult film "Death Race 2000". That alone is worth the price of admission.

(Frankenstein lives!)

review: This probably the best in the Carmageddon series for me. IMO it offers more challenge than C2 and running over pedestrians is more satisfying. I would totally recommend. review:
Supongo que es por cuestiones de nostalgia que recomiendo este juego

No soy muy fan de las mecanicas (Si quisiera solo destruir cosas en un entorno m√°s justo no s√© , jugaria Flatout 2) perosi quieres jugar a este titulo pues bien , aunque no es un port
Usa un emulador y es el juego inicial puramente , con todo lo que esto conlleva y la resolucion por defecto es bajisima y encima puede tener fallos en estabilidad por la compatibilidad

Desde mi punto de vista el port a movil est√° mucho mejor trabajado , mejores graficos , un menu de mas calidad , es un remaster

author: {'steamid': '76561198025447982', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1622842648}
review:
Carmageddon is an amazing, unique game and one of my all-time favourites. For that alone, I have to recommend it. That being said, the version being offered here is frankly quite terrible.

You get to choose between software mode and 3dfx mode. Software mode is visually outdated even by 1997 standards, so most people will play the 3dfx version. Both options run in DOSBox - and while I think there are good DOSBox ports out there, this is not one of them. The menus and cinematics tend to be completely broken. With some config modifications, you can get the 3dfx version to run in a decent resolution (and without stretching) and improve the terrible sprite pop-in, but I've been unable to fix the framerate in any way - and it is awful. These are "only" technical issues, but they're serious enough that I can't honestly recommend playing this specific version of the game.

The real issue here is that Carmageddon is [i]not[/i] abandonware by any means. Just a few years ago, Stainless Games released Carmageddon: Max Damage - a reimagining of the original game which is not nearly faithful enough to be considered a replacement in my opinion. The Max Pack on sale here even has Steam trading cards, so the developers clearly acknowledge its existence, yet they've made no attempt to actually make it a version of the game worth selling on Steam. Most annoyingly, there actually exists a version of Carmageddon that not only runs perfectly but also includes countless little fixes and improvements, essentially making it the ultimate way to play the game - and it's the Android/iOS port. That version is practically perfect, with only the fatal flaw of being mobile-exclusive (meaning that if you want to play it, you'll probably have to use the worst controls imaginable). It also doesn't include the Splat Pack expansion at all.

What we really need is a PC port of the Android/iOS version, with the Splat Pack added as well. Alternatively, if the source code was released to the public, I'm sure some dedicated fans would soon create a proper source port. As things are now, though, Carmageddon is an incredible game that you can't really play properly on modern hardware and you probably won't be happy with the version on offer here.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198043135631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2248, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1593296148}
review:
And this is what I call the blast from the past.
Carmageddon was great on that PS1 console.
I used to play it a ton when I was just a child.
Even though this game isn't for kids, I know.
But anyways: It's simply a really good game.
Sure, nowadays it's pretty old and outdated.
I'm simply happy that I have it in my steam.
This is a piece of my childhood, I loved this.
So much fun, so much nostalgia, it's great.
It's still quite enjoyable to actually play this.
Honestly, the default price seems too high.
It's over 20 years old at this point, so yeah.
Thankfully I grabbed this during a discount.
And I'm gonna give it a positive review too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103016991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1603131331}
review:
Le tout ici n'est pas de replacer le jeu dans le contexte de son √©poque, ni de vous conter la gen√®se de ce morceau d'histoire controvers√© du jeu vid√©o, mais bel et bien de vous recommander, ou pas, ce titre, aussi sensible au r√©tro soyez vous, au cas o√π l'id√©e vous viendrait √† l'id√©e au d√©tour d'une solde par exemple.

Eh bien non. Certaines oeuvres ont leur place dans un mus√©e. Carmageddon est de celles-ci.
Quasi-injouable aujourd'hui (l'expression "caisse √† savon a d√ª √™tre invent√©e pour ce jeu, tellement il allie la lourdeur √† la maniabilit√© improbable), les touches peuvent √™tre rebind√©es mais en r√©alit√© √ßa ne fonctionnera pas car il s'agit bien du jeu original qui tourne sous dosbox donc tenter d'assigner les touches de votre pad moderne sera mission impossible.
Bon courage donc pour maitriser la physique tellement fastidieuse qu'on imagine mal que la manette aurait aid√©e au probl√®me.
Ajoutez une lenteur √©tonnante et un al√©atoire de tous les instants (les sorties de routes soudaines parce que le mod√®le physique de la voiture √† but√© sur du rien en ligne droite est l√©gion) et une difficult√© accrue par la complexit√© √† maintenir son v√©hicule (donc √† √©craser des pi√©tons qui bougent, seule mani√®re de gagner les pr√©cieuses secondes obligatoires pour ne pas √™tre √† cours de temps et aller au bout de la course), et saupoudrez des soucis inh√©rents au fonctionnement sous Doxbox, freeze, bugs audios, et clicks qui ne passent pas dans les menus.... et il ne restera que la bande-son entra√Ænante et les gerbes de sang pour distraire. Ce qui ne suffira pas √† combler la frustration.

J'insiste sur le sens de mon avis: est-ce que je vous conseille de jouer √† Carmageddon en 2020 et apr√®s  (et s√ªrement des ann√©es avant ?): Non. Et pas parce qu'il a vieilli, je ne crache pas sur le retro et pourrait vous inciter √† lancer plein d'autres jeux plus ou moins vieux. Simplement parce qu'il a TROP vieilli, et qu'il n'est plus jouable que par quelques fous furieux ou nostalgiques qui ont encore les contr√¥les d'un autre temps dans les doigts.

Rest In Peace, Carmageddon, apr√®s tous les passants que tu as √©cras√©, ta mort est de bonne guerre

author: {'steamid': '76561198092121287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1168, 'last_played': 1601005892}
review:
I grew up playing Twisted Metal, so I knew this would be pretty fun too, and it was. Although it didn't run great, it was still very enjoyable.

Pros:
-This game is not politically correct
-Fun gameplay
-Lots of different characters and maps, between the base game and it's expansion pack

Cons:
-It doesn't run very good. With graphics set to highest options, I average around 20fps on a relatively high end PC
-DOSBox
-Sometimes opening the game results in a black screen
-Trying to use the Steam overlay while playing causes it to stay up. Pressing Shift+Tab about 20 more times may fix it
-No point in Alt+Tabbing, you'll have to close the game; trying to maximize it will result in a black screen
-Trying to quit the game from the menu results in a black screen. Alt+Tab and Task Manager do not bypass it. Easy fix is just signing out by using the Windows key

Overall, it is a fun game. Most of the cons are avoidable after figuring them out. Have fun unlocking the Suppressor.

review: Whilst this game may have been good back when it first launched (I wouldn't know as I didn't play it back then) this version is unplayable. Upon loading the game for some unknown reason movements are bound to numbers rather than WASD.  Unless there is some patch I don't know about then Id  say stay well away from this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979953970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 490, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1596204054}
review:
Reviewing games I played a long time ago:

I'll recommend this for the game iself which is great and brings back good memories. I can't, however, recommend this Steam version (it's based on GOG DOSBox). Even though it "works" it is however too limited for nowadays in terms of resolutions and compatibility. I'll recomend installing the Max Pack Restoration Project to be able to choose resolutions (doesn't support widescreen though) and play in windowed mode for example. https://steamcommunity.com/app/282010/discussions/0/611703999981147655/

The game itself is great, the driving physics are weirdly realistic, I remember as a kid just driving through the checkpoints and ignoring the destruction and deathly part of it, only because it was so fun to drive the cars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180023407', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1592977254}
review:
Carmageddon doesn't deserve a thumbs down. But just like in my Max Payne review I'm giving it a thumbs down because Stainless Games hasn't fixed there product. Carmageddon works out of the box unlike Max Payne but what it doesn't do is play or look good at all. I highly recommend installing and configuring the "Unofficial Max Pack 95 Restoration Project Pack". I'm not going to walk you through how to configure it since it pretty much says but if you need help feel free to message me if the thread you got the mod from doesn't help. 

Now onto the game itself. Carmageddon is great fun at first but I quickly realized while playing it how little the game mixes itself up. You start with three maps unlocked. Each map that's completed awards you with at least a rank as long as you don't suck and every three ranks you unlock a new map. This already means you're going to have to replay maps over and over again but this wouldn't be an issue if the maps themselves were interesting. Out of the thirty, they all feel like carbon copies of about six unique maps. And a lot of the "new" maps are actual copies. They're the same maps but just with different routes and weather types. Because of this, the game doesn't have any progression. After eliminating opponents there is a chance that they will become playable after the race but the issue with this is that the best car in the game is your own. Besides a change of pace, there's no reason to use the other vehicles. The game does, however, give the player a lot of options. When in-game you have the option of racing, taking down your opponents, or if you're a masochist eliminating all of the pedestrians. This is close to impossible however since levels can have over five hundred of these little time pinatas scattered throughout them. Speaking of, you can lose a map by running out of time. Time is acquired by running over pedestrians or slamming your car into the opposition. The thing is unless you're new to the game you won't be running out of time on any of the difficulties besides the hardest one. So if you love the taste of pain be sure to play the hardest difficulty since you can't change your difficulty on the fly. Since I started the game on medium I'm going to have to either finish it on medium or start the whole game over. The aforementioned ranks are acquired at the end of the map and the number of ranks you move up is proportionate to the number of credits you have. Credits are gained by doing just about everything. Slamming into other cars, running down pedestrians or cows, going through checkpoints, scratching your ass, and so on. These credits are used during the actual game to repair or recover your car. What this means is that sloppy play isn't punished, you just won't be ranking up as fast. But the maps are all carbon copies so why do I care?! See the problem? Carmageddon is a hell of a lot of fun but it feels more like an arcade game then a game you're supposed to binge play for 30 hours. The thing is the key loop of the game is a lot of fun. Finishing off your foes, running over crowds of people, and messing with crazy powerups all are great time wasters. But if the game was way shorter and had actual difficulty it wouldn't just be a time-waster. With just a few tweaks the game could be an adrenaline rush. The problem is it's more of a casual murder simulator than a Twisted Metal rival.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996890045', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1590522429}
review:
Carmageddon Max Pack is a reproduction of the original Carmageddon game, enabling it to be played on computers with Windows XP/Vista/7.

It's a bit of retro fun - just the thing for those who want to relive their old memories of this game - which caused a bit of controversy when it was originally released.

Potential buyers should be aware that, compared to modern car games, Carmageddon is ancient stuff.
If you're after great graphics and superb gameplay, then Carmageddon is not for you.
Just buy it for old time's sake.

As an aside, I had a bit of trouble running it (on Windows 7). It seemed that a Windows graphics prompt was causing it to go awry.
Tried to run it three times, but each time it would go to a black screen, and it wouldn't allow me to exit the game.
Then I found that when I went to close it down via the Windows Task Manager (via Ctrl-Alt-Del), that I could actually play it whilst the Task Manager was running in the background. Nice one.

You can set four separate lots of controls.
However, you can't set the arrow keys (which are used for angle of view).
Nor can you set the S key (it looks like it can be set on the screen; however, it's actually set permanently for "Sound", and won't work in the way you reset it).

Carmageddon Max Pack is really only meant for those who want a bit of computer game nostalgia, so it should only be bought on that basis.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989290281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1589658271}
review:
Still a fun and crazy classic, but there are some issues with the controls. Getting a controller to work will require a third party mapping app, and some of the keys are hard coded and cannnot be rebound.

For it's time it's pretty advanced with vehicle weight and speed actually having an effect, as well as different weakspots and strategies needed to eliminate the AI drivers. There is also cockpit views!

It's hard to believe the controversy this game created as it is quite tame by today's standards. However if you ever wanted to see a deathrace 2000 video game - here it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049823783', 'num_games_owned': 1712, 'num_reviews': 1265, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1583542422}
review:
Un gran juego de finales de los 90 Traido para PC, se ve y se juega igual que hace 23 a√±os, una pena que el motor de fisica y la conduccion sean demasiado toscos y arcade para mi gusto.

No envejecio muy bien aunque esta bastante aceptable y divertido, cantidad decente de carreras, autos y partes, podes ganar dando las vueltas (lo mas facil) - chocar y destruir a tus competidores (mediano) o atropellando a todas las personas del juego (dificil), tambien hay bonus de objetos rompiendo barriles y demas que dan mas tiempo, dinero o powerups temporales, como por ejemplo escalar por las paredes, baja gravedad, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079187939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1679315439}
review:
Fantastische demolition/road kill racer ! Toen in 1997 en vandaag de dag even leuk en knap in elkaar gestoken tracks. De beste Carmageddon ever !
Wel opletten als je in 1920x1080 wil spelen en je hebt maar een i3-2120 (jaja die gamers bestaan ook nog) dan is het best dat je in de map gaat van Carmageddon onder dosbox. Daar start je even nglide_config op om de resolutie op bvb 1280x720 (of 1024x600 wat nog beter is qua performance) te zetten, je zal zien dat het beter speelt. Dat is te wijten omdat dit een oud spel is en geprogrammeerd voor de PC's van toen.

Voor de prijs, zeker in sales, moet je deze game in huis hebben (of je hebt een hekel aan racers of je bent een moraalridder tsja dan is het niets voor jou :)
De rest met gezond verstand en toch een beetje knettergek: kopen, hit the pedal to the metal and crush them all !!!

review:
It's old but *very* playable. I recommend using the 3dfx mode as it delivers cleaner graphics. Also the keyboard combo of a-z-alt for your car's driving mode works well. In this version, the "people" are real people and when you run them over, red can be seen. Back in the day, there was an outcry, "it's terrible", "why run over people", etc., so the programmers changed the blood to green, so they were aliens posing as humans, or something. 

Either way, worth your time if at least for the first 6 or so races.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962829908', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1568189863}
review:
IMO this is one of the greatest games of all time, i couldnt tell you how many hours ive spent cruising around in it and smashing up peds.

I think Carmageddon was one of, if not, the first driving games that allowed you to go off the track to find your own way or just explore instead of trying for the best time or position in the race.
The car physics and damage model were top of the line for its time and the driving physics are still very good.
Environments look great of the tech available at that time.
The tone of the game is dark but highly humorous and that has rubbed off on me for life, i was into cheesy action flicks at the time of the release, after it i found i highly enjoyed b-level splatter, sci-fi and horror as well.

The music in the game is amazing, probably the most memorable soundtrack for me, i used to pop the game cd in my stereo, skip the data track and listen to the music when doing other thing.
When MP3s became i thing i always had instrumental versions of the Fear Factory albums off which the soundtrack is taken in my playlists.

This dosbox port runs the 3dfx version so you get higher resolution and 3d acceleration for higher quality graphics, looks very good on my tv from the couch where im sitting, runs way better than it did on my 60mhz pentium with 12mb of ram i initially played it on :P

It might not be as interesting for someone that has not got the nostalgic connection to it but i still think it should offer a good laugh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167851808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1567894678}
review: Carmageddon is an amazing game and I would love to be able to play it again. I thought this would have been an updated version to run on modern machines but it seems to just be the original attempting to run in dosbox and it runs so poorly its unplayable, at least on windows 10. I should have read the description better but I was so excited it was on here I didn't bother. If someone would make an HD rerelease of this that ran decent and maybe smooth out the textures some I'd easily pay 50-60 bucks for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198837709357', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1550361705}
review:
[h1]Road raging at its finest![/h1]

Ever got so fed up with traffic in real life that you sometimes wished you could just put the pedal to the metal and plow through the whole lot? Well...  now you can ;)

However... keep in mind that this review is about the original DOS game now going back an easy [i]20 [u]years[/u][/i] ago, so if you're new to the series you may also want to look into a more modern release such as the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/505170/Carmageddon_Max_Damage/]2016 Max Damage release[/url].

[h1]Total carnage awaits...[/h1]

The setup is simple: there's a race between several "VMD's" ("Vehicles of Mass Destruction", lol!) and you're one of the contestants. While you could start racing and going through all the checkpoints like a good sports...  who'd want to do that? Nah, instead of finishing first why not make sure that the others won't be able to finish [b]at all[/b]?

You're in a massive map which has tons of things to explore and secret passages to find, there are a load of pedestrians on the streets but you can do something about that as well. And as for the other cars... either smash into them and watch as their bodywork slowly begins to crumble and smoke. Or maybe try to pick up one of the many powerups and try to destroy your opponents that way.

This thing has "road rage" written all over it and it does an amazing job too!

Of course... this game is not for the faint of heart, because the things you're going to do to the cows which are also in the game?  Just horrible I tell you!  ;)   (the only animals in the game are cows which can also be run over).

[h1]In conclusion...[/h1]

I was very surprised to discover that Steam still carried the original DOS game(s) so I immediately picked up on them. These days there are more games which allow you to do a bit of road raging, sure, but nothing beats the original I think!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079795608', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1689687289}
review:
A blast from the past.
Everything about this game is kinda off.
Everything is with it's flaws.
But with all it's weaknesses it offers great fun.

The obvious fun is in the trailer: Some rather wide arena with cars you can either beat by being fastest (which happens every 25th race or so because you actually wanted to see it happen), or by killing every last one of the others by destruction derby. Additionally there is a timer. You don't get time for reaching checkpoints, you get time for driving over people, cattle or anything else that doesn't move out of the way fast enough. The inherent brutality is a huge selling point here.

It has strange physics, that make you fly around for no reason. But, a well hit high speed crash really feels heavy too.
The vehicle feels light, is easy to oversteer (which would suggest a very heavy vehicle) and then snaps into spinning. Not oversteer, just spinning. It's recommendable to break, then go for the run in handbrake. High speed cornering just doesn't happen. There is a chance to find ways up rooftops and such, just to fall down again. There are pickups that offer some weird effects (like wall climbing, jelly suspension that makes your car undrivable and such) but they are more gimmick than mechanically important.

I always had huge fun with the game, because it really turns bonkers up to eleven. It's unapologetically stupid and raw. Including it's awful design flaws. But that makes it's charm as well. I will always love that game for what it offers. It's sort of a guilty pleasure. The portrait of you, the driver is a hilarious idea as well. These sort of characters in racing games (Slipstream 5000 had that too) totally got lost in the nineties. Well. Really stupid fun. If you look at it expecting a good game, stay away, it has far too many flaws. If you can't wait to hear Anna screaming in fear because you go 300mph while closing in on a solid wall ...then well. Give it a shot. The "Uwaaaah" and "Eeeeeeeh" will always be in my memories. As well as the many sounds for crashing and the many undrivable cars. I just love this mess of a game.

review:
Awesome rather, simple game.

You drive around and follow this sort of competition that has you racing over rooftops (yeah you heard that right), among other sort of open world racing and it will have you doing doing all kind of unconventional stuff to gain snippets of time, as for the timer not to run out.

Oh, did I mention what happens if the timer runs out?

[spoiler]You lose.[/spoiler]

Great, somewhat simplistic (but fun) game from the time when a lot of unique surprises came rolling along.

[spoiler]This still happens, [i]today[/i].[/spoiler]

Si algunos lo culpan por esta violencia gratuita, a los otros les tomar√° horas de placer caminar por los muchos circuitos al volante de sus autos, todo lo que es m√°s basura que los otros por las carreras violentas, r√°pidas e intensas. ¬øUn juego que no perdemos f√°cilmente, excepto para jugar despu√©s?

review:

Por ah√≠ no le doy un 10/10 por el tema del emulador, DosBox es medio mierda y hasta en una PC con un i7 (notese que DosBox no usa GPU) te corre los juegos en -30fps. Pero bueno, es jugable y te sent√≠s de vuelta como cuando reci√©n sali√≥ en su √©poca.
Una masa, yendo a lo factible del juego, si te gustan los juegos de carreras, matar gente, autos llenos de cuchillas, raros, la sangre, recorrer mapas libremente y sos un depravado mental, este es un juego para vos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962876566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3555, 'last_played': 1510250041}
review:
English developer Stainless Software's "antidote to racing games" was originally intended to be a demolition derby type of game. Both the Mad Max and Death Race 2000 licenses were considered, but fell through, and what emerged from that was Carmageddon. 

Breaking from British racing game tradition, Carmageddon isn't about finishing first. I don't even think the opponents can actually finish the race at all. They just drive around, crashing into each other. It's more like Twisted Metal, but without weaponry. Each stage is set in a sandbox-type level filled with hundreds of pedestrians and a few armoured police vehicles. There are three ways to complete a stage. Either you do all the laps, but like I mentioned you get no competition from the opponents; you destroy your opponents by crashing into them, which can be a little tricky at times because it seems like you have to hit them at the right angle to do damage; or you run down and kill all the pedestrians, which can take quite a while. 

To progress in the game you have to increase your rank. You start at number 99 and have to work your way up to number 1 to unlock the last stage. In order to increase your rank you have to get a certain amount of credits on each stage, depending on which difficulty you're playing on. You get credits for running people over, crashing into your opponents, going through checkpoints, etc. You lose credits if you reset or repair your car, which is done by the press of a button while driving. The car kind of buckles out like in the John Carpenter film Christine, which is cool. There's a time limit on each race, which at first may seem kind of low, but you easily gain time in the same way you gain credits, except you won't get any time for actually racing. 

Controlling your car in Carmageddon isn't the easiest thing to do. I can't really think of a game with similar steering. When you're driving slowly you have decent control, but when you get up to speed and try to turn it's like the car understeers, or a slight turn could make you lose grip and spin out. I usually use the handbrake for cornering, drifting tens of meters completely sideways before gaining traction again. It could be that the lower than normal gravity impacts the steering. At least it effects the way you jump, which is quite cool and makes the game more unique. It's sort of like racing on the Moon. 

The game's biggest draw is being able to run people down and being awarded for it. It's not a very challenging game, but it's a relaxing one where you can just sit back and have fun. If you destroy your opponents cars you sometimes unlock them and can use them yourself. They all have a unique cockpit view, if you're into first person racing. Some of them have better steering, some are more powerful, and some are faster, especially a drag racing car which goes insanely fast but can barely steer. My favorite car is the one you start with, because it's the most balanced one, plus it's modelled after David Carradine's car in Death Race 2000. 

There's a handful of locations in the game, from the big city to the coast, a chemical plant, a winter resort, etc. You'll have to revisit these places a number of times, racing different routes. This gets a bit repetitious because the routes often cross previous routes, and if you drive around trying to destroy your opponents or kill pedestrians, it's basically just like playing the same stages over and over again, considering they take place in the same sandboxes. The game is a little too long for its own good, but if you play it a little here and there instead of plowing through it in a couple of seatings, it's great fun!

----------

Carmageddon Splat Pack, which is also included in the Max Pack, is an expansion for the original Carmageddon, containing a bunch of new levels and a number of new cars. There are new pedestrians as well, and some new power-ups, but since the levels are the main thing I'll give some short comments on those. 

Mayan Magnificence Hotels: Set in a Central or South American hotel resort with architecture resembling the ancient local civilizations. Well-designed map that is fun to play. 

MagnaChem Rural Developments Inc.: Rocky and green prison island surrounded by mountains. Not that exciting. Lots of fluffy sheep though. 

MagnaChem Abandoned Ice Station: Snowy industrial roads with gaps you have to jump every now and again. Nothing special. 

Craggy Isle Dam Complex: This map consists of two islands: one is bright and colorful, with palm trees and a small nice town, and the other is dull and gray, with a boring dam in the middle. 

MagnaChem Environmental Disaster: Kind of lackluster. A bunch of high bridges binding together a bunch of small dusty islands. 

Nerdberksring Race Circuit: Actually a proper race track. Adds some variation to the mayhem, but it would be nice if the level had some stunt jumps as well. 

Musty Ramparts Theme Castle: A large medieval castle filled with hallways. Good for smashing into the other cars. There's also a gravel road that goes through a decently sized outdoor area. 

And last but not least, and possibly spoiler alert since you only get to play this map at the very end: 
Hell: A big and confusing map that takes place in the underworld, complete with a graveyard, lava pits and burning demons, a flaming bar, Eskimos on ice, and the Devil himself. Takes some time to learn, but once you know how to get around the level is pretty fun. 

----------

This release isn't exactly remastered, but I could get it to play fine in 1920x1080. It runs through DOSBox and works fairly well. I'll give it a solid 3 out of 5 car crashes!

review:
El original Carmageddon, correr, atropellar personas, destruccion y caos en la cuidad.
La splatcam(camara del conductor) lo hace mas divertido con las expreciones de Max Damage y Die Anna.
Tiene potenciadores, poderes y de mas para que la diversion del caos nunca termine.
100% recomendable para comenzar a jugar esta franquicia.
Parra ser un juego auntiguo vale la pena, eso si, esta emulado en Dos-Box, asi que cuidado con los requerimientos de tu pc, pueden afectar los fps.
Puntuacion: 9.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197987722190', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 185, 'playtime_forever': 1766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1691862592}
review:
Carmageddon... Le top du top en mati√®re de controverse √† sa sortie en 1997. Ce jeu de course, ou plut√¥t de combat motoris√©, a construit sa notori√©t√© sur la possibilit√© de rouler sur les pi√©tons avec moult effets gores √† la cl√©. Fort heureusement, le titre a plus √† offrir qu'une collection de sprites sanguinolents. Il y a d'abord la conduite tr√®s sp√©ciale : les v√©hicules sont lourds et r√©agissent logiquement √† tous les impacts tandis que la gravit√© du jeu est tr√®s faible. Un curieux m√©lange qui donne √† la fois des sensations r√©alistes mais engendre aussi des cascades d√©mentes. il y a √©galement la gestion des d√©g√¢ts : la voiture se d√©forme en fonction des chocs subis et reprend gracieusement sa forme d'origine sur demande. Une petite prouesse technique pour l'√©poque. Si on ne peut pas parler de monde ouvert, on a clairement droit √† un gameplay sandbox puisqu'il est possible d'explorer comme bon nous semble les environnements. Chaque course peut √™tre termin√©e de trois mani√®res : soit en finissant le nombre de tours impos√©, soit en √©liminant tous les concurrents soit en √©crabouillant tous les pi√©tons du coin. Si les deux premi√®res options sont viables, la troisi√®me est r√©serv√©e aux vrais psychopathes compte tenu du nombre √©lev√© de pi√©tons dans chaque lieu et de la difficult√© de tous les atteindre. Cette version 'Max Pack' comprend √©galement le Splat Pack, l'extension officielle du jeu. Celle-ci ajoute une quantit√© respectable de contenu avec de nouveaux v√©hicules, circuits, pi√©tons et m√™me une nouvelle bande-son ; quasiment un second jeu en termes de dur√©e de vie.
Alors faut-il jouer √† Carmageddon de nos jours ? Si on n'y a jamais touch√©, non. Les graphismes piquent les yeux et il y a de toutes fa√ßons la version Max Damage de 2015 pour d√©couvrir la s√©rie. Si on y a jou√© √† l'√©poque, la nostalgie et le gameplay bourrin feront tr√®s certainement effet !

author: {'steamid': '76561198334051853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1534692959}
review: Es un juego muy divertido y para la √©poca en que fue hecho gr√°ficamente estaba bien, supo ganarse su fama al ofrecernos unas fren√©ticas carreras en las que todo val√≠a y donde llegar el primero a la meta era casi tan importante como atropellar a todos los inocentes peatones que pudi√©semos, sin olvidarnos de destrozar a los veh√≠culos de nuestros rivales.
