author: {'steamid': '76561198070712973', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1504280041}
review:
Make sure to download the Win95RPP pack and use something like xpadder to hook up your gamepad - and quite frankly I think Carmageddon gives racing games released in 2017 a run for their money.

- Great art style
- Great music
- Actual driving physics
- Varied vehicles
- Varied tracks
- Vehicle damage
- Open world style gameplay with places to explore

The live-action reaction portrait is something that every game needs. I'm not sure why this died out with Doom and Carmageddon :(

Honestly once you have the high res and gamepad up and running Devolver Digital could release this today and it'd be a hit - it's not just a nostalgia trip.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080028990', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1696487927}
review:
When I'd first gotten Carmageddon back in the day, I'd gotten just the CD, no manual or instructions, so I didn't know what sort of game it was. I think I was familiar with the idea of racing games with weapons, but I'd always thought that racing was an important part of it.

In Carmageddon, racing is probably the least important part of the game.

The first time I tried it out, I tried running through the checkpoints. Even then, I was aware of how bad I am at games, and wondered at how I'd managed to leave everyone behind. But I kept losing the race because I'd run out of time. Why wasn't I getting time for going through the checkpoints? Was I missing any shortcuts?

Then I tried it again, and went off the track...

Carmageddon was advertised as a "vehicular combat game". There are three ways to win a race. You could try and run through the checkpoints, but you'd still have to find a way to build up enough time to do so. You could fight and "waste" your opponents (by ramming into them, or ramming them into something; no ranged weapons here), or by killing each and every one of the hundreds of pedestrians on the map.

It's quite clear what the game expected you to do.

You gain time by running over pedestrians, damaging and killing your opponents, or running over green barrels scattered (and hidden) off the track. There are various power-ups, also in different coloured-barrels, which range from the very useful (solid granite car, electro-bastard ray), to the weird (instant handbrake, giant pedestrians) to the terrible-but-in-a-fun-way (bounce-bounce, jelly suspension). You can repair your car at any time, but it costs you money, money which you'd earned by running through checkpoints, killing pedestrians, killing opponents, or doing weird things like flipping your car several times off of track geometry (cunning stunt bonus).

Money can be used between races to upgrade your car in three areas, offence, defence and speed. I think that the upgrades apply to all of the cars in your garage, but I'm not entirely sure. To be honest, I'm still not sure how cars were unlocked. Every once in a while, a car that you wasted will become unlocked for you to race around in, but I'm pretty sure it was random. Not every car is unlockable, so no Countslash, no De'Gory'Un. Sorry. In later games, you could buy them out, but here you just get them randomly, and it's only a small portion of them.

You start out with a choice between two cars and drivers, Max Damage with his Eagle, and Di Anna with her Hawk, cars which look similar, but had different stats and different engine placements. Di Anna, I felt, had an unfair advantage, because you'd have less to repair after every crash since her engine was well out of the way during the various head-on collisions you'd go through.

The music is by, according to the wiki, Fear Factory, which explains why it sounded so familiar. No lyrics, but it is loud and heavy. 

It still looks pretty good for a DOS game. Yes, this game is in DOS, and Steam runs it in DOSbox. It runs very smoothly, even (or rather, especially) the 3DFX version. You wouldn't think you were running a 20-year-old game. The damage-model is especially nice, with different areas of the car deforming from impacts and crashes.

I wonder why all of my favourite games were open world and had extensive damage models? Something to think about...

The feel of the car isn't very racing game-ish. Modern racing games are very sensitive about grip and drifting, but Carmageddon is a bit... floatier? Not sure if that's right. The cars will skid around, and different surfaces will be treated differently, but it really isn't a racing game. It's not bad, but after something like Mantis Burn Racing (or even Gas Guzzler Extreme), you can tell that this isn't a hardcore racer.

I got Carmageddon Max Pack free when I bought Carmageddon Max Damage. It's still downloading, so I thought I'd give this old thing a whirl. It holds up pretty well, I'm just not sure if you should buy it. I got it for free, so I'm happy, though I'm not sure if I'll play it if I have the newer, prettier version around. I got them both for USD 5.00, and I'm surprised that this bundle wasn't advertised more heavily.

Download it for your tablet or mini-PC, Carmageddon is a part of gaming history. Just don't pay too much for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4082, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 75, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1572052303}
review:
You know you want this, it's one of the greatest game of the 90's, for a game of that time, it sure is beautiful, Hell, it's better looking than most of nowadays video games, no blur, no depth of field, no other bullcrap that "hides" the uglyness of nowadays games.
Pretty great game overall, still worth playing despise the release of Max Damage, first-person driving is better and better looking than in the new one to be honest, driving is overall better but only by a bit (in my opinion), music is great,  what pains me in the new one is that you can't see your dude and his facial expressions, that is such a good addition in my opinion.

Anyway, I suggest it to anyone who likes carnage, adrenaline, Destruction Derby (game), Death Rally (game), Twisted Metal, Mad Max, Interstate 76 (game), Motor Mayhem (game) and perhaps FlatOut. They kind of share some similiarties between each of them.
If you like adrenaline games such as Unreal Tournament, Quake or Duke Nukem, you may like this if it doesn't bother you to play using cars, and well, perhaps Postal 2? Same kind of mayhem but with cars instead, difference is, this game is pure quality.


Fu** yeah!/10   (9.5/.10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198344714295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1544322800}
review:
In my opinion, this game is great for those looking for a fun racing game and or some 1990's nostalgia.

The gameplay is extremely fun, especially when you start picking up power-ups like "Acme Damage Magnifier," which increases the damage you do to other cars, and "Solid Granite Car" which does exactly what it sounds like.

A major downside is that, to my current knowledge, there is no free play mode, unlike in Reincarnation and Max Damage. So you can't say "I want to have nearly unlimited time and credits for this race!" or something like that.

The vehicles are quite an interesting bunch. There's sports cars, trucks, racing cars, hearses and dune buggies, just to name a few. You can unlock some of these vehicles by wrecking them when they are "Stealworthy," although the game doesn't tell you when they are, or, at least not in my play time. Not all vehicles are playable, though. Each vehicle has a damage model.

The physics lean on the side of realistic, opposed to arcadey.

The damage modeling is hugely advanced for 1997. Some games today don't match up. A major downside is that no parts come off of the car and, sometimes, the car will start to "tear apart" and have transparent patches.

The vehicle modeling is slightly below average, the car bodies are good but the wheels are blocky. The windows on all vehicles are chromatic, so you cannot see inside. There is an interior view option, but the interior appears to just be a .GIF of the dashboard, pictured inside of the vehicles.

The pedestrians, which are the, pun intended, meat and bone of the Carmageddon series, are bitmap sprites. The animation is pretty good all things considered. If you hit a pedestrian, they explode into a pile of pixelated gore.

The graphics are average for 1997. Draw distance is a bit close due to the size of the maps.

This game is a tricky if you aren't absolutely amazing at racing games. The opponents basically have the mindset of every Grand Theft Auto Online player ever. There are police in big trucks, too, and they compound this. The game also does not give you much time...You start with 1:30 on the clock. If it reaches 0, you lose. Hitting pedestrians, smashing opponents at speed and doing cool stunts gets you more time.

The soundtrack is small, but good. It features three Fear Factory songs as well as a few 90s-tacular electronica songs.

This game takes some grinding to get through, unless you rack up the credits like a madman. You can gain credits through the same ways as gaining time, as well as going through checkpoints.

There is no traffic to my knowledge, just scattered parked and junked cars.

The level design is...Well, I haven't really fiddled around enough with racing through the levels to tell you. The maps are decently sized, though.

The controls are a bit silly to me. But, then again, I rarely play PC games.

The heads up display is lackluster. You have to push a button to bring up the map. Camera is slow to rotate outside of the car, and only shows one of three directions in the interior view. One of the game's gimmicks is the "Prat Cam," where there is a .GIF of your selected player model reacting to how horrible your driving is.

Overall, if you can take the mental trousers A.I. and playing the same fun levels over and over again, I absolutely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022104383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1493388483}
review:
Ever since the 1990's, when 3D gaming was still an infant, they constantly pushed the boundries of what was possible. Whether it would be a 3D shooter game, racing game, RPG game, or a strategy game, they all played well and looked good.

Carmageddon is no exception. Ever since this game came out during teh 1990's, it's been the hottest racing game ever. Not just because it's a racing game, but it's a racing with a challenge as well as having mini goals. You're not just racing to survive, but you're also racing to smack the hell out of as many pedestrians as possible. With the many kinds of odd racing out there, this one is still king (IMHO) as well as started it all.

Course, you don't have to just go through all the check points to win the race, just bash the hell out of some other racers and take them out of the race to win. The only challenge is that you don't get much time to do this, as the timer ticks down the longer you are racing.

For those who are not familiar with the game, some of the many features include...

1.) Gain time by running over people, performing cool stunts, or smacking racers just right
2.) Power ups lay all over the race which give you either land mines, extra time, or a spiked tail (Don't ask)
3.) Ability to buy vehicles and upgrades as you progress through the game
4.) Gain money by winning the race, killing all other racers, smacking peds, or performing stunts
5.) Many race tracks and 40+ (Main game + Splat pack) vehicles to choose from
6.) Complete open worlds, explore to your hearts content on each race track
7.) Peds count ranges from 200+ to 500+ per race track
8.) Race hard enough, and earn the super armoured police vehicle

And so much more. Keep in mind of course that the graphics are not up to par with todays 3D gaming, but then the game is over 20 years old.

Overall, a fun killing spree with a feel of a racing game, and with so many cars to choose from, you will want to race even harder to get those vehicles in your list. Race against other racers, slam some peds, and bash other racers out of the way. What more could you want in a racing game?

author: {'steamid': '76561198258445335', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 1498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1352, 'last_played': 1599580184}
review:
Okay. First of all, DON'T buy unless you're willing to do some patching up to get this game running smooth on modern systems. It will highly, highly unlikely not run smoothly right outta the box.

Then, the review. Good stuff:

- The gameplay. Has aged without any decay. Complete the race by wrecking all other competitors, running over all pedestrians in the level (not easy..) or drive through all the laps (there's no positions, only the checkpoints need be passed, all laps completed).
 There's complete freedom to do as you please, this really is a standout feature. The derby action is good fun. Crashes are properly satisfying. Running over pedestrians hardly gets unfun either, what with the great sounds and over-the-top gore.

- Large maps with much to explore and find, for the game's age. And if you are to complete a race by killing all the peds, you're gonna have to somehow get your way to building roofs and other not-easy-to-reach places. The maps have a wide variety of themes too. For example, a city, mine shafts, tropical island, Mayan ruins, coastal area..

Atmosphere. First, the character roster, where nobody is normal nor sane. And everyone has fittingly cool and crazy cars too, first of course, Max Damage's Eagle, then for example there's a monster truck with drill in front, Delorean with some painful-looking blades in it's front, etc..Visuals are nice when it comes to art style. The graphics haven't aged very gracefully but the art style is nice, there's a suitable amount of grit.

What sucks: 

This release. Doesn't run smoothly right outta the box. First you gotta install 95RPP, then see if it'll make the game work nice. If it doesn't try replacing the DirectDraw wrapper that comes with it by removing from game's folder the ddraw.dll and replacing it with DGVoodoo's.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972445514', 'num_games_owned': 1850, 'num_reviews': 249, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1648265487}
review:
To think this game came out in 1997 yet is still so playable and satisfying today with its solid gameplay.

CARMAGEDDON is a pure visceral thrill ride of stress venting that leaves me totally relaxed afterwards with its amazing though exaggerated physics system as one crashes into oppenant's racing cars seeing them take physical dents along with falling parts damage from the high speed impact. Its great to see touches of realism like ones engine smoking after taking a headon collision. This same smoke will obscure your vision just enough to make hitting oppenants and pedestrians a bit more difficult but in a fun non frustrating way.

Enemy ai is very well done with them giving the illusion of having their own purposes. Sometimes they'll ignore you while going against other racers and other times they'll hunt you down for many a street city block especially if you just bumped into them "accidently" :D Pedestrians will scream in terror at your approach and will start running for their stinking lives when they see you racing like a bat out of hell down the street.

Graphics are sweet in their brutality. It is quite a joy mowing down an old granny in a walker who reminds you of a certain passive aggressive senior citizen we have all had to deal with. CARMAGEDDON takes the wait out of waiting for the nursing home staff to show up to take them away as they scream in terror before you pile drive them with your race car against a building wall sending guts eyeballs and entrails flying everywhere. Ooo and what a squishy sound they make as i run over their dead bodies afterward. Then theres the sexy boys... ooo i hate sexy boys!

Sound effects are top notch from the screeching grind of cars rubbing up against a building to the POW! of crashing into public telephones and street lights. Its a real riot hearing pedestrians death screams when scoring points for killing them along with time bonuses. If one does a fancy move or stunt while killing them one is awarded even more points and or cash. Hearing your character cracking jokes or cursing really adds to the sense of immersion.

A timeless classic full of black humor and relaxing venting still absolutely playable and still gives any "modern" racing game a run for its money.

Thanks Interplay and SCi for the endless fun :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197977158883', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1486491952}
review:
Carmageddon fue uno de los juegos que marc√≥ mi infancia. Un cl√°sico de los juegos de conducci√≥n, por su violencia (algo nunca visto en un juego de coches por aquel entonces) y por su frenetismo y diversi√≥n,con carreras a velocidades de infarto y llenas de violentos choques y atropellos. Sali√≥ en el 97 y 20 a√±os despu√©s a√∫n lo sigo disfrutando como el primer d√≠a.

Esta versi√≥n es exactamente la misma que el cl√°sico de PC, con lo bueno y lo malo que ello conlleva. Como positivo pues tiene todo lo que hac√≠a bueno al original, Como negativo pienso que era bastante f√°cil hab√©rselo currado mucho m√°s como s√≠ han hecho con la versi√≥n para m√≥viles, que incluye mejoras gr√°ficas y en jugabilidad, logros, etc. Podr√≠an haberse currado un port de la versi√≥n de m√≥viles a PC ya que lo ten√≠an hecho, pero de todas formas se agradece la posibilidad de poder rejugar este cl√°sico tal y como lo conocimos en su d√≠a.

Os dejo mi lista de pros y contras:

PROS:

- Uno de los juegos de conducci√≥n m√°s m√≠ticos de todos los tiempos

- La violencia

- La sencilla jugabilidad

- Las f√≠sicas

- La sensaci√≥n de velocidad

- Los m√≠ticos veh√≠culos

- Poder acabar las carreras de tres formas: llegando el primero a la meta, matando a todos nuestros oponentes o matando a todo ser viviente del nivel

- Funciona perfectamente en ordenadores y sistemas operativos actuales (probado en Windows 10 de 64bits y en varios ordenadores actuales)

- Posibilidad de jugarlo con la aceleraci√≥n 3D de 3DFX

- Incluye la m√∫sica

- La polic√≠a y su brutalidad

- La variedad de veh√≠culos

- La enorme extensi√≥n de los escenarios

- La posibilidad de mejorar el coche

- El modo replay para ver desde cualquier √°ngulo y en cualquier momento las repeticiones m√°s bestias

- Tiene modo multijugador

- Las deformaciones de los veh√≠culos

- Tiene cromos Steam


CONTRAS:

- Se pod√≠an haber currado bastante m√°s esta edici√≥n de Steam como s√≠ han hecho con la versi√≥n para m√≥viles

- No tiene sistema de guardado en la nube como s√≠ tiene la versi√≥n para m√≥viles

- Inferior t√©cnicamente a la versi√≥n de m√≥viles, pod√≠an haberla porteado

- No tiene logros Steam

- muchas veces tendremos que ir a buscar a los rivales que estar√°n volcados por el escenario sin poder moverse

- Ganar las carreras destruyendo a los rivales es un m√©todo bastante sencillo dada su poca resistencia en comparaci√≥n con la de nuestro veh√≠culo

- Totalmente en ingl√©s 

- Precio algo elevado para un juego tan antiguo si se compra por separado, mejor esperar a las ofertas como hice yo


CONCLUSI√ìN: Su diversi√≥n, sencilla jugabilidad, las realistas deformaciones de los veh√≠culos, la f√≠sica de los coches, la conducci√≥n, la brutalidad y la violencia, la posibilidad de terminar las carreras de varias formas... hacen de √©l un aut√©ntico juegazo que ya obtuvo valoraciones sobresalientes en su √©poca hay√° por el 97 y que a√∫n a d√≠a de hoy har√° disfrutar a los m√°s nost√°lgicos y a los que no pudieron disfrutarlo en su d√≠a pero quieren conocer uno de esos juegos que marc√≥ un antes y un despu√©s en la historia de los videojuegos.


Si mi an√°lisis te ha servido de ayuda o te ha gustado, agradecer√≠a que dejaras tu valoraci√≥n positiva para que pueda leerlo m√°s gente. No dud√©is en escribir abajo si ten√©is cualquier tipo de duda. ¬°Un saludo y gracias por leerme!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076420130', 'num_games_owned': 1224, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1655678085}
review:
Carmageddon ''MS-Dos version'' is a controversial and violent vehicular combat / car racing game, where the player must compete against a number of computer controlled opponents. Running over pedestrians and damaging opponents cars grant time bonuses and credits to be spent for upgrades.

Give me one good reason not to like this.
A classic, good old game for the hardcore gamer. 
A must have !

author: {'steamid': '76561198022690152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1501356848}
review:
I recieved this in the bundle when buying Carmageddon:Reincarnation.
This is a game I used to play as a kid (no I haven't run over anyone yet) and after all these years when it finally came out on steam and able to play on modern Windows PC's far easier than manually making it work, I got back into it.
This game for its time had some amazing physics to go with it, each crash was different, burned areas on cars wherever they caught fire, lovely exploding peds, Annoying AI which when you finally waste their ass it's damn satisfying.
If you have recently gotten into Carmageddon with the new games that have released, the original one has the smallest differences, and is definitely worth a play to see where and how this game began.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072028556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1664307589}
review:
Not only the bloodiest driving game ever done but also one of the best driving games of all time. Its driving and damage system was terribly advanced in its day and even now can put some AAA to shame.

Funny, bloody and entertaining, a must.

By the way, probably the dosbox emulation won't let you experience the game as well as it deserves. I would rather recommend to buy the android/ios version and play it on a tablet as it's [strike]recompiled for those specs[/strike] more enjoyable.

I got it as a gift for buying carmageddon: reincarnation

author: {'steamid': '76561197987175590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2003, 'last_played': 1484762619}
review:
[u]What I liked about the game[/u]

‚Ä¢	The gameplay can be very addictive and fun, especially when you're running over pedestrians and destroying other drivers. 
‚Ä¢	I liked the idea that you can see the driver in the top left-hand corner, seeing his facial expressions, when something happens during the level.  
‚Ä¢	You have three different ways of winning each level. My favourite was destroying other drivers. 
‚Ä¢	I liked the arcade style of the game.
‚Ä¢	The vehicles in the game are awsome, You can also unlock other driver's vehicles and use them in other levels. 
‚Ä¢	You can upgrade your car. 

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]

‚Ä¢	Can be frustrating sometimes, police can be a pain in the arse. Sometimes you don't get credits when you should. Sometimes the last driver can prove tricky to kill. 
‚Ä¢	The vehicles in the game can be hard to control. The vehicle brakes aren't very good and sometimes turning a corner is like turning a ship.
‚Ä¢	Out of the three different ways of beating the level, destroying each driver is probably the best way to beat the level, because killing a certain number of pedestrians takes too long and doing the laps isn't very rewarding.
‚Ä¢	The soundtrack does get repetitive and so does the gameplay, especially towards the end. 
‚Ä¢	It's a shame you can't visually see the upgrades you made to the car. 
‚Ä¢	When playing Carmageddon on dosbox, dosbox seems to flicker a lot, especially when the game is loading the main menu. When the game is loading up, I keep seeing my internet browser and a message flicker on and off.
When I double click to skip the intro sometimes I return to my internet browser and when I click back on the application to return to the game, dosbox black screens. 
	  
 
[u]Conclusion[/u] 

A fun and addictive game, which is different compared to over racing games. It can get repetitive, but I still recommend it to any retro gaming fan. 
70/100

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198142611999', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1102, 'last_played': 1453615219}
review:
Ahh, Steam me dando alegrias mais uma vez. Atropelar o pedestre da bandeira sempre foi uma boa sensa√ß√£o.

Poder jogar Carmageddon novamente foi muito bom.
A princ√≠pio pensei que n√£o conseguiria faz√™-lo rodar no meu notebook. Mas ele j√° vem com o DosBox configurado para poder jogar. Basta instalar o jogo e rodar. Gostei muito.

Caso seu jogo esteja rodando com baixo FPS v√° na pasta DosBox do jogo (na pasta onde o jogo foi instalado) e execute o arquivo nglide_config. Ajuste como precisar. Aqui eu coloquei o Refresh rate em 60 Hz, desativei o 3Dfx logo splash screen e desativei tamb√©m o Vertical synchronization.

Pra quem jogou o jogo na √©poca do lan√ßamento qualquer coment√°rio √© dispens√°vel. Mas para quem est√° chegando agora se prepare para um jogo sangrento.

Voc√™ pode vencer as corridas de tr√™s maneiras:
- Completando os circuitos de cada fase passando pelos checkpoints;
- Atropelando todos os pedestres das fases.
- Destruindo todos os seus oponentes.

Cada uma delas √© uma divers√£o √† parte. Mas destruir os inimigos √© a mais divertida. Voc√™ pode se chocar contra eles, derrubar de pontes, empurr√°-los contra bombas, etc

Mas cuidado. Eles tamb√©m est√£o te ca√ßando pelas pistas. E al√©m dos carros dos outros competidores em certas fases √© importante ter cuidado com os carros de pol√≠cia e uma unidade especial da pol√≠cia. Eles s√£o mais fortes e n√£o est√£o afim de te levar preso. S√≥ o seu presunto.
[spoiler]Se quiser pegar um carro especial da pol√≠cia destrua o carro especial da pol√≠cia nas fases Blood on the Rooftops e Surreal Thing.[/spoiler]

Nas fases tamb√©m existem barris com efeitos especiais. Os verdes d√£o dinheiro ou tempo. E os demais podem dar efeitos especiais muito bons e perigosos. Poder usar gravidade de j√∫piter e carro de granito foi muito bom.
E lembrar da pior maneira poss√≠vel o que acontece quando pegamos um barril com modo pimbal e um buraco perto.

Como dito no fim do manual do jogo: Se voc√™ tiver pesadelos sobre pessoas estourando tente jogar domin√≥ em vez de Carmageddon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040167019', 'num_games_owned': 3194, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1551008440}
review:
Ah, Carmageddon, a game where you don't just race other opponents, but also try to destroy them, and run over hundreds of innocent pedestrians in the process. Wicked fun. And you are rewarded for all of this, which makes it even more fun. The game even lets you know how many pedestrians there are on each level, so you can make sure every single one is mangled.

There are some old games that I think have really good looking graphics, even though they aren't very realistic like modern games. Carmageddon is one of them. There's a grittiness and personallity to the graphics that new games don't have. The lower detail of the graphics also gives the game a little more challenge, as it can be hard to see things coming up at times (at least before you get used to the graphics}.

The game can be annoying at times though. I found the vehicle handling/controls hard to get used to as first. At least with one car, you can easily get stuck to walls, and have to steer into the wall to get free. That doesn't really stop being annoying. Also if you go too fast up a steep hill, you can end up launching off and flying way too far, and will end up needing to be recovered. These minor things don't detract from the fun though.

The game has some good music that goes good with the game. There some rock songs and some electronic songs. But if you don't like them or get tired of them, you can always turn on some Metal. Metal goes great with this game.

Carmageddon is a lot of fun. If you like games like Postal or GTA. If you like running over people, wrecking cars, and causing chaos, then you will like this game. If you haven't already played it and don't own it, then you should get it now. Or when it's on sale.

9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198037347067', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 3488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1672584675}
review:
[b]Intro[/b]
Innovative and important, but a relic that hasn't stood the test of time. I recommend the mobile port, but not this lazy release.

[b]The Great[/b]
++N/A

[b]The Good[/b]
+Splattering peds is so damn satisfying.
+Graphically looks charming.
+Levels can be fun to explore.
+Smashing cars is entertaining.
+Physics are fairly impressive for its time.

[b]Mild Issues/Things to Note[/b]
+-Draw distance is low even at max. Unlike other games of its time, this hampers the experience. It's not a big deal, though.
-+Solid soundtrack, but repetitive.

[b]The Bad[/b]
-The floaty gravity mixed with bumpy but sharp geometry makes for uneven terrain that can often get you stuck in silly ways or makes driving a pain.
-Takes too long to unlock cars, and the game doesn't even let you use all the ones the AI use. Half of them are useless as well.
-Requires you to tediously replay levels to progress.
-Greased tires, bouncy, bouncy, pinball, lunar gravity etc. aren't fun or funny, they're just annoying.
-The monetary penalty of recovering is too damn high. This problem is emphasised with the Splat Pack where endless pits are frequent.
-Enemies die by falling into said pits. Even if you ram them down one, you don't get the points for it. It's frustrating as they kill themselves or you accidentally nudge them down a hole as it hampers progression. This is mainly an issue with the Splat Pack.
-The timer's irrelevant as it's easy to gain time.

[b]The Terrible[/b]
--Vehicle handling is slow and unstable on any surface that isn't tarmac... which makes for a very small percentage of the levels' terrain.
--Animations seem to run at 30FPS or lower, making for jittery looking vehicle movement even when running the game at well beyond. This DOSBox release also sucks as it's very difficult to run the game at a steady framerate. Unless you have a really good CPU, you're not going to be hitting 60FPS. I tried desperately to get the game running well but I couldn't.
--It's not true of course, but it feels as though the AI purposely tries to piss you off as much as possible. Whether it's slowly nudging you in the side fruitlessly while you can't move, hitting you out of nowhere, being nowhere when you get a good powerup, moving out of the way at the last second, etc. Feels like cars reset while you're not looking with heavy momentum to repeatedly ram you without having to actually take the time to gain the speed like you do.
--The mobile release of this game (which is in itself a port of a port which was cancelled) is cheaper and runs and looks significantly better. Why they couldn't port it to PC, I have no idea. Perhaps they're just lazy. This is one of the only times I'd recommend a mobile version over a PC game, but it's significantly better performing.
--The Splat Pack expansion levels suck ass. They're full of massive pits that either make you recover back to land (which costs a lot of money) or means that everyone ends up off course trying to ram each other on rocky terrain. It's terrible level design, as visually interesting and diverse as the levels may be.

Content/Replayability: 6/10
Audio: 4/10
Graphics: 7/10
Gameplay: 3/10
Overall: 3.5/10

[b]Conclusion[/b]
The main game is okay, if frustrating. Splat Pack on the other hand, is nothing but a chore. Skip this and buy the sequels instead, which I all highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015438406', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1475915312}
review:
The first / true Carmageddon game released back in 1997 !
Never actually played this one, started with Carmageddon 2 and played TDR2k so yea.. but i'm playing it now !
Its actually very fun, u can notice that the graphics are a bit behind of the other two games but as a true carmageddon fan that i am, i easily ignore that hehe.
I'm actually surprised this game has 6 more levels than the 2nd game but way less tracks, its basically diferent versions of the same, same, same tracks !
But since i'm playing it for the first time, what the hell, frack it ! :D

Ok, now the real review...
Been playing it on DosBox, its very playable, until now i haven't met any problem, besides game crashing when i messed with the files to change the draw distance, but hey, u dont need to mess with the files to begin with !
I'm surprised that the cops on this game are so frickin' hard to kill and since i'm playing on Hard dificulty(commonly known as Dificulty 3) the APO, most known as Upgrades of your car, are very very expensive on this dificulty.
I'm almost level 4 in all of the APO as of now, and i still find it hard to wreck a police car, dang.
I love the rank system on this game, u start out at rank 99 and your goal is to hit rank 1.
If i'm not mistaken i'm in between rank 59 and 55, when u get the hang of the driving in this game, its really easy to get several ranks from a single track(by "farming" alot of credits with combos from killing pedestrians) and thus, u can buy several APO.
Also, something that every carmageddon game has(and some u buy cars dont steal) its the stealworthy feature, some cars that are stealworthy u can wreck them to add them to your garage, but its not 100% chance rate to add them to the garage when u wreck them, so beware of that.
I'm trying to reach the latter levels so i can steal "The Supressor" the ultimate and most armored car on the game, like the normal cop cars. but this one has like 8 wheels or something.
So like i said before, for an old game its been running great, without problems(on dosbox ofc!) and i've been enjoying it, so far i've played for around 20 hours and i'm still a bit far from the end of the game.
I highly recommend this game !
Too bad the multiplayer is basically impossible to work at this time.
It would of been too fun !
But for that u can play the new carmageddon game, Carmageddon : Reincarnation !

Hugs and kisses for everyone !

review:
Es divertid√≠simo, recupera tot√°lmente el esp√≠ritu del primero de la saga. Las f√≠sicas son espectaculares, el coche se despieza casi por completo. Los √≠tems son una locura, y han mejorado el uso de los mismos permitiendo tener varios en un inventario y usarlos cuando creamos conveniente. Los circuitos son demenciales y los peatones no se ven tan descompensados de tama√±o como en entregas anteriores. Una de las cosas que m√°s me ha gustado ha sido la introducci√≥n de tipos de prueba distintos, ya no solo hay que completar una carrera de los tres modos distintos, haciendo las  vueltas, acabando con los oponentes o matando todos los peatones (tarea imposible sin el "Electric BLue") si no que tambi√©n podemos jugar a cazar el zorro o a llegar al peat√≥n primero que los dem√°s. En resumen, el precio est√° muy bien para el total de horas que se pueden hacer, ya que los mapas invitan a perder el tiempo dando vueltas. No s√© si a√∫n est√° la oferta, pero en el momento que lo compr√©, inclu√≠a todas las entregas anteriores, Carmageddon Splat Pack, Carmageddon 2 y Carmageddon TDR2000.

"Slaudos"

review: You'd think with a low-graphics game like this, it would run on just about any computer. author: {'steamid': '76561198029972608', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 406, 'playtime_forever': 188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1426773158}
review:
[b]PROS:[/b]
+ really fun gameplay
+ great soundtrack
+ lots of tracks
+ 90s racing game feel
+ classic Carmageddon

[b]CONS:[/b]
- almost no players in multiplayer
- outdated graphics
- sound issues when running 3dfx version
- clunky controls (unable to set your own keys)

[b]Comment:[/b]
Nostalgic trip to the 90s reveals an awesome game back then that currently still is pretty good. I got this in the Carmageddon: Reincarnation bundle but honestly I bought that bundle just to get this and Carmageddon 2. I used to play the two games back in the 90s on the PC of my cousin and it was a blast. Although it has aged, this is still a nice racing game. There are some issues though. The 3dfx graphics, although older, are nice but this version caused sound issues on PC when the sound would just stop. The no-3dfx version feels a tad bit too clunky visually. The key binding is fixed and even though you can pick from 4 variants it still would have been nice to be able to configure your own setting. Also maybe worth mention is that although Steam gives you options for multiplayer it does not have many players around so it is not worth bothering. Soundtrack and effects are really really great and the racing feel you get is nice (enhanced by the big amount of tracks). A cool retro game worth recommending.
------------------------------------------------------------------

review:
Zagrywa≈Çem siƒô w demo Carmageddon, jako dzieciak, godzinami. Gra jest ≈õwietnym lekarstwem na stres. Mo≈ºna wy≈ºyƒá siƒô setnie w jej, chorym i brutalnym, ale na szczƒô≈õcie, wirtualnym ≈õwiecie.

Mechanika gry w skr√≥cie: wybierasz samoch√≥d, stajesz do wy≈õcigu, rozwalasz wszystkich na torze=wygrywasz, rozwalasz przechodni√≥w (starasz siƒô o odrobinƒô finezji)=zdobywasz kasƒô i dodatkowy czas, jeste≈õ humanitarnym nudziarzem perfekcjonistƒÖ i unikasz wgniece≈Ñ i zadrapa≈Ñ, ale docierasz na metƒô pierwszy=wygrywasz! Proste? Banalnie! WciƒÖga? Nieprzyzwoicie!

Technikalia.

Grafika w≈õr√≥d m≈Çodszych graczy na pewno nie wywo≈Ça efektu WOW, ale szczerze? To jest jedna z tych produkcji, kt√≥rej wypieszczone, wypolerowane i fotorealistyczne wodotryski wizualne sƒÖ zupe≈Çnie niepotrzebne (choƒá jak na swoje czasy gra prezentowa≈Ça siƒô przynajmniej bardzo dobrze).

W kwestii ≈õcie≈ºki d≈∫wiƒôkowej oraz samych odg≈Ços√≥w... niestety r√≥wnie≈º s≈Çychaƒá drobne braki technologiczne. Szumy i niska jako≈õƒá sampli przy bardzo dobrym sprzƒôcie audio mo≈ºe nieco irytowaƒá. Natomiast sama jako taka ≈õcie≈ºka muzyczna do gry zosta≈Ça dobrana ≈õwietnie i podkrƒôca dodatkowo poziom adrenaliny (w sk≈Çad wchodzi kilka utwor√≥w, w wersjach instrumentalnych, metalowej kapeli Fear Factory). Ilo≈õc utwor√≥w nie jest jednak poka≈∫na, co z kolei mo≈ºe spowodowaƒá, ≈ºe z czasem s≈Çuchanie tych samych kawa≈Çk√≥w, podczas d≈Çu≈ºszej sesji, mo≈ºe nieco znudziƒá.

Podsumowanie.

Plusy:

- krew, zombie i totalna rozwa≈Çka na torze
- dynamika rozgrywki
- absolutnie jedna z najlepszych gier wy≈õcigowych w historii gier komputerowych

Minusy:

- zdarzajƒÖ siƒô framedropy (sprzƒôt testowy (laptop): Intel Core i7-2670QM, 8GB RAM, Nvidia GT 555M 1GB RAM, dysk SSD + dysk zewnƒôtrzny USB 3.0)

PodsumowujƒÖc. 

Totalna rozwa≈Çka, jakƒÖ mo≈ºna w Carmageddon sprokurowaƒá sprawia tak wiele frajdy, ≈õciganie przechodni√≥w i wycinanie ich w pie≈Ñ w szale≈Ñczym wy≈õcigu z czasem i r√≥wnie bezwzglƒôdnymi przeciwnikami nie ma sobie r√≥wnych po dzi≈õ dzie≈Ñ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038558991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 851, 'last_played': 1424819108}
review: In 1997 society's number one enemies were Grand Theft Auto and Carmageddon. I think later GTA games were partially influenced by Carmageddon series because it was one of the first pioneers of open-world car games in 3D world. This game is just classic. Very nostalgic vibes. I recommend it for everyone who loves GTA series, Flatout series, Destruction Derby and these kind of games. I do not recommend this for peaceful car racing/simulation gamers. This is not car porn. Tuning means something else here. This is rust and twisted metal, spikes and blades, blood, sweat and tears, smoke, oil and industrial waste. This is somekind weird radioactive-biohazard experiment with experimental killing machines with engines and innocent human beings. Just so unacceptable. Road rage at its best. If Trevor Philips ever wanted to be a car game, I'm pretty sure he would wanna be the one and only: CARMAGEDDON!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040005010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 491, 'playtime_forever': 2226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1423872853}
review:
No me gustan los juegos de carreras, pero mi unica excepcion es este. El clasico Carmageddon, un juego tabu para mi epoca (1997-2000). Que hermosos recuerdos era jugarlo a escondidas, debido a ¬®lo controvertido e inlegal¬® en mi pais, ya que jugar este juego era peor visto que cualquier crimen.
 -Lo mejor
 -La libertad: pues, este fue el primer sandbox considerado por muchos y para mi lo es. Con todo los honores: Puedes salirte de la carrera y provocar todo tipo de caos, de atropellar a la gente y si terminas con todos los peatones, ganas. O completar la carrera normalmente, o ganarla de la manera injusta, matando a todos los competidores. 
 -el apartado artistico: Es muy bueno y grandioso el ambiente que le dan las texturas y los peatones(¬øsabias que las animaciones de estos, son dibujos sobre una persona quien realmente era atropellada?), los colores mixtos, aunque la mayoria calidos y con textura hiperrealista. El interior de los autos era lo que mas me encantaba del juego, hasta lo considero el mejor de la saga solo por este detalle: El interior del auto esta muy bien dibujado y detallado, se combina el verdadero exterior 3D del auto, con una animacion en 2d del interior, mostrando el bolante, el velocimetro, el hud y los accesorios del piloto. Realmente una belleza.
 -La jugabilidad: Realmente muy bien lograda y con un buen realismo al estilo del auto: Estan los livianos, cuya maniobilidad es turbulenta, son rapidos, y cuesta usarlos y los pesados, quienes son lentisimos pero con un manejo excelente. Pues, hay autos solo para carreras, los medianos o solo para destruir.
 Lo malo:
 -Despues de un rato se vuelve algo monotono, un poco repititivo, ya que esto se pone as√≠, si nos enfocamos en destruir los autos. Repito: solo se vuelve repititivo si nosotros decidimos buscar a los autos y destruirlos. Ya que si hacemos la carrera, nos encontraremos con verdaderos desafios.
 -Conseguir autos: aqui se vuelve algo complicado y fastidioso, ya que es como una ruleta: despues de una carrera alguien te desafia y estas realmente animado por ver que auto te toc√≥ y nos topamos con los indeseados. No podemos comprar el auto que queremos, tenemos que ser desafiados por sus pilotos para obtenerlos y esto, pasa 1 de cada 10 carreras que nos tocan.
 -Inmortalidad: Asi es. Nuestros autos o mejor dicho, conductores, son realmente inmortales. Ya que lo unico que nos mata, es que se agote el tiempo. Pero no los choques ni explosiones. Algo decepcionante, ya que siempre, he querido ver la cara del conductor al ver su expresion tras ser asesinado por otro competidor o la policia. Aunque esto sea una ventaja para nosotros. Tambien, contaremos con dinero que si o si, nos sobrara para repararnos, rescatarnos y revivirnos.
 Despues de todo esto. le doy un 9 de 10. Realmente buen juego. Lastima esos peque√±os detalles.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967992446', 'num_games_owned': 1179, 'num_reviews': 545, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1421006572}
review:
Carmageddon isn't just an awesome game because it's essentially the playable version of the movie Death Race 2000 ([url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tO-YkaXGtLM]which is available in the public domain on Youtube[/url]), it's a great game because the hard difficulty turns the game from a bloody yet loose open-world pedestrian masher into an actual racing game that requires quick thinking and huge balls.

I personally think Carmageddon plays it too loose with its formula. You get huge, huge amounts of time to actually complete the race, and every car you destroy or every civilian you run down adds a not insignificant amount to it. I wanted it to be more like an actual race, one where you have to quickly explore and find the secrets in order to get enough time to either finish or kill your opponents. Something quicker and snappier. I found out that Hard mode solves all of my complaints - you start out with 30 seconds, which means you need to start driving on the sidewalk immediately to turn wholesome North American guts into fuel for your hell vehicle. It encourages breaking off from the "track" to see the city and find new exciting pedestrians to murder. It is tough as shit but it is well worth it to see all the cool hidden areas the developers thoughtfully put in. It's that or wander around the track until you decide that killing every pedestrian is a fucking tedious exercise and end up destroying the other combatants. Or finishing the race, because you are 50 years old and you need to get back to filling out your Old People Forms.

Anyway, Carmageddon is one of the greats and despite my moaning about it it's still goddamn fun to play after all these years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009739783', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1420460579}
review:
A good way to remember old times.
A game way ahead for its time. Blood, metal and Gazoline, all you need to let the day go by.
I remember playing this back when I was in secondary school on a friend's pc.. amazing memories.

Bad news is that the game has quite a few problems. Crashes, FPS drops, sound muting bugs, bad save game handling and so on. Things that ofc didn't really exist that time since most of the bugs appear due to the modern OS conflicts.

I'm not sure if you should pay to get this game now unless you are an insane fan of the franchise or unless you grab it on a special offer on on the franchise pack that is available with the new 3rd franchise addition that seems to be very promising and worthy.

Cheers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040317132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1431016032}
review:
Finally after years of waiting, years of sitting there as a kid watching my dad run over countless pedestrians, zombies, cows and plowing into cars with extreme agression, with the visually awesome cars and crazy tracks and epic metal music to keep you steering on the road. Finally I get to play it :D

For anyone having doubts that this won't run on newer systems, my system is pretty "beefy" and it runs fine through DOS-box, the controls are a bit iffy with the numpad and the steering seems to have a mind of its own when you suddenly end up swirving all over the place uncontrollably. Other than that, this game is bloody amazing :D Probably one of the few racing games I actually enjoy and is actually unique!

review:
Sin duda un cl√°sico y uno de los juegos m√°s pol√©micos de la historia.

Est√° claro que no ha envejecido demasiado bien a nivel gr√°fico, incluso con el 3Dfx y el nGlide activados. Pero sigue manteniendo la jugabilidad y adicci√≥n que ten√≠a en su √©poca.

A pesar del elemento m√°s pol√©mico, que es poder atropellar gente (ya puede, la saga GTA, dar gracias por abrir el camino), su mayor jugabilidad radica en su componente m√°s destruction derby.

Buen juego sin duda, es un 'must have', aunque sea por tenerlo en nuestras estanter√≠as virtuales.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003433597', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 163, 'last_played': 1418151812}
review:
Un pu√±etazo de nostalgia en la cara... para lo bueno y para lo malo.

Sigue invitando a la conducci√≥n por libre y la exploraci√≥n de unos escenarios maravillosamente dise√±ados, adem√°s los controles han envejecido razonablemente bien y su humor negro (especialmente la [i]Prat Cam[/i]) mantiene ese cojonudo toque de serie B, casi Z.

Lamentablemente los movimientos de c√°mara pueden llegar a desesperar, especialmente con la marcha atr√°s y los derrapes, y eso, en un juego en el que la maniobrabilidad es tan importante, es una cagada bastante inmensa. Tambi√©n hay que decir que el no tener [i]power ups[/i] activos le resta algo de versatilidad.

Por √∫ltimo a√±adir que algunos usuarios tenemos ciertos problemas con el rendimiento del juego, que corre sobre Dos Box usando el nGlide 1.02

Recomendable, pese a todo, porque la mezcla de exploraci√≥n, humor bobalic√≥n y gore sigue siendo una mezcla de conceptos bastante dif√≠cil de ver en los juegos de conducci√≥n, y porque a nivel de mec√°nicas y tono sigue siendo razonablemente distinto de la segunda y tercera parte.

Aprovechad alguna oferta o, mejor a√∫n, comprad [i]Carmageddon: Reincarnation[/i] y llev√°os la colecci√≥n completa.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005952628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1662901325}
review:
The noblest pursuit of all gamers and petrol heads is encompassed by this masterpiece of digital entertainment.

A timeless classic has been brought back from near extinction. The cumbersome obstacles such mastering the reverse-engineered DOSbox and the long outdated supported Operating Systems and 3DFX cards of yester year are no longer the illuminating beacons holding the guiding light toward vast citiscapes of twisted metal and burning rubber.

Here, today, on this mighty platform we can share the elation of blazing through crowds of gormless pedestrians and wildstock, the exhilaration of t-boning your adversaries with an oversized dump truck and the exhaustion of being rammed all night long, unrestricted, uncensored and untainted by the passage of time. 

Do I recommend this game? Yes.
Was my childhood a bright one? Yes.
Will you be forever ruined as an upstanding citizen of your country? It goes without saying, but... YES.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012886450', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1431481400}
review:
This is the classic that paved the way for many racing games to come. 
This is a game that in 1997 created the racing game sandbox experience that would become a staple for the genre only many years after. 

The way cities are sectioned into multiple tracks, and the way it doesn't impose a single objective, the way you can change focus between doing checkpoints, running over pedestrians, wrecking your opponents or just exploring the sandboxes is so ahead of it's time that even now, almost 20 years after it's release and after the mist of controversy has dissipated, it still feels fresh and an achievement in videogame design.

That it's gameplay and it's itch can still be scratched only by itself even now, so many years after it's release and so many clones in between says much more than anything that has probably been written.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008369673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1518373837}
review:
This game I got as a gift from a friend and holy...goddamn it takes me back some 15+ years back into my mid-teens....I missed this game so much!!

For the ones that dont know, this game was based on the 1970's film Death Race 2000. This game become an instant cult hit back then when games were going through the hard time of being too violent ect.  It stood out because, yes it was graphic and violent, but also it was a different sort of racing game.  In such you can win a race by doing all the checkpoints in order and doing laps like a regular race, wrecking your opponents cars ( my tactic of choice ) or killing every single pedestrian on the map.

Along with these unique races come proper zany as hell power ups.  Like my faves Solid Granite Car and Pedestrian Electro-Bastard Ray...yes thats a thing...and many more, even combining into some outstanding effects.

The AI racers also have some good AI as well.  They are set in their ways and go about racing their own way.  Some wanna race, some wanna run over peds and some just wanna turn around and ram you all shapes to Sunday.

Yes the game looks dated, so what!?  its a great game to begin with and has a sweet soundtrack, with 3 tracks supplied by Fear Factory from their album Demanufacture.

Nice and simple upgrade system, no fussing around or logic needed, just choose either upping your Offense, Armour or Speed.   

All in all I am personally pleased this game has made it to Steam and give a new generation a chance at what was once one of the worlds more controversial games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009168410', 'num_games_owned': 1549, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1408320593}
review:
Carmageddon is an absolute classic and one of the best driving games you will ever play.
The Story and goal of each level is basically: Run over pedestrians, destroy your opponents, win races :P
One of the main features that set Carmageddon apart from other racing games is the variety of ways you can win each race as well as the wide open maps.

The easiest way to win each race is to just destroy your opponents and while your opponents get stronger the further you progress, the Power. Armour and Speed upgrades you can put on to your car will help immensely.
The other 2 ways are the bog standard checkpoint route and running over every single pedestrian which will take a LOT of time as there are hundreds of them every race and hidden all over the track.
There are also plenty of powerups strewn throughout the races both fun and useful such as an electro ray and frozen opponents, or disadvantageous to you such as jelly suspension and turbo cops.
Speaking of cops, you will occasionaly encounter them as you first play but towards the end there will be cops around almost every corner and are very hard to destroy making the later courses fairly difficult.

The graphics are still very playable to this day with nice car and damage modelling, funny pedestrian sprites and a decent variety of track layouts to explore. The audio is equally decent with a kickass soundtrack from Fear Factory and the crashes and clangs of each car not to mention the funny quips from your pratcam driver.
With over 30 cars to drive when completed and over 30 tracks to complete there is plenty of value to be had, not to mention the splat pack expansion which adds an additional 20 tracks and cars each.

Overall Carmageddon is a timeless classic that all oldskool pc gamers and racing fans will enjoy,

review: Just as I remember it, except with all the RAM it can use. I had a Compaq Pentium MMX with 16Mb RAM. But since I was on Windows, only 14 was left and this game was running on low memory mode (Thx!) that makes all piedestrians the same. This was one of the first three games I've ever owned on my computer as a teenager (other two being Warcraft Battlechest [WC1, WC2, WC2 Expension] and Duke Nukem 3D). I am overjoyed that Stainless is taking it back (TDR2000 wasn't up to the name). I'll leave it to recommended, but I'd suggest you focus on Carmageddon Reincarnation.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976440425', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1405006125}
review:
Ah, Carmageddon, a hideously beautiful relic of my misanthropic adolescence, back from the grave. 
This is a DOSBox-emulation-and-all resurrection, so while I'm happy to say it's still damned entertaining to play, most of the old issues remain, or have worsened with time. The cartoon physics are as spotty as ever, and the rock-stupid A.I.  goes from quaint to frustrating in five minutes flat. As is the sad fate of nearly every early use of 3-D graphics, the game's visuals have aged horribly: The low maximum draw distance is the most harmful to gameplay, but the game's entire appearance is so primitive that it can take a minute before your eyes can even decode the blobby, jagged blur of early polygon magic whizzing by you. All of that said, none of that completely negates that one most important thing: FUN. Nasty, sneering, blood-drenched fun. Making cars go smash, plowing through churchgoers, and, for the more advanced student, crushing and electrocuting two entire football teams, all remain as satisfactory as ever.
Bottom line, it's a bit of cult gaming history, perfect for fans of racing and comedic ultra-violence alike. Buy it for the snotty, sneering little twerp inside of us all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960393604', 'num_games_owned': 2763, 'num_reviews': 243, 'playtime_forever': 1854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1680, 'last_played': 1404879725}
review: This game is not without its flaws, but it is still massively fun to play.  It comes with a Glide wrapper, but DOSBOX needs to have the config files edited to enable it.  Once you do so, you'll be able to get the game in much higher resoutions than were available before by using the 3DFX version.  The ranking system in game is based entirely on how many points you earn in a match, so find a good map that you can get a lot of points on and grind it as much as possible.  You can unlock some cars through play, but when you finish all the maps in the game and 'beat' it you unlock everything, even cars that don't unlock normally.  The levels do not confine you to one track, you can explore to your heart's content - assuming you don't run out of time.  Even the semi-Stand Alone expansion, the Splat Pack, is included.  Just remember, this is an old game with some early design ideas that didn't always work well, but the game IS very fun to play and enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992868669', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1413083383}
review:
To anybody who hasn't heard of Carmageddon series before, one sentence can describe it perfectly: players are rewarded for killing everything, enemies and pedestrians alike. It's a racing game at heart, but you can finish the race either by actually racing, killing every one of your opponents, or running over every pedestrian in the track. The latter is the most difficult, as there are typically about 400-500 peds per map.

While the game has certainly aged and carries  with it the stigma of its 1990s-era graphics, there is little in the way of alternatives that offer a better experience at this time. Suffice it to say, if this game is up your alley, you can deal with the graphics. And you will, because the game is that worth playing.

Don't go into this expecting a story. Go into it for completion, for upgrading your car and becoming more proficient in killing everything in sight, and you'll love this game beginning to end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000347510', 'num_games_owned': 884, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1683783269}
review:
*Includes Impressions Video*
Where to begin with this classic entry of car carnage? It's race how you want at its finest. You can either wreck your opponents or drive over all its spectators (read: everyday bystanders and pedestrians), or merely hit all the checkpoints (still driving way off-track to get there quicker). Hitting opponents and peds award time and credits, the latter used to upgrade your vehicle's armor, engine, and offensive strength. Your race profits determine how many rankings you rise, which unlock new routes and environments to crash through. Once you dip into sub-80s, you unlock additional vehicles through random chance after wrecking certain opponents.

There are dozens of crazy car designs that all handle differently, included with driver info for the completion of crazy. Your standard Eagle (or Die Anna's Hawk) has very good starting stats and will carry the player through most of the game even so though. Once you beat the game, you may want to drive the inaccessible ones even...

There is no race happening, no concern about position, no pit-stops, and no rules. For the player, there is no option but first place. You may get bonuses by knocking objects and lampposts into the peds, driving backwards or sliding into them, or sandwiching them on a wall. Power-ups (although temporary) add to this chaos. They can modify your abilities, increase your engine power, respawn all peds, freeze opponents, turbo the opponents, allow you to drive unhindered underwater, increase your damage strength and so on. This game has introduced some of the wackiest additions to races, including but limited to, Pinball Mode, Jelly Suspension, Gravity From Jupiter, and Wall Climber.

The damage modeling is dynamic and even today we are only just starting to refine how this is done, such as with BeamNG and Next Car Game. Burnout may be considered one of the first, but Carmageddon really is the first to feature real-time 60 fps 3D racing as well as dynamic damage modeling based on how you have collided your car. No two impacts are the same (and your opponents will never be left the same!). Internal damage is incurred through these high-speed impacts and usually matches the severity of the cosmetic damage. Each component is given a damage indicator which moves from Unmarked, Green, and Red/Orange, to flashing Red, finally Black - Damaged wheels are not straight on the axle and bounce your car around, while a broken transmission will constantly stall your car back into the first gear. A damaged steeling column will hinder your turning ability, randomly making it turn the opposite way, with blackened disabling steering altogether.

The Max Pack includes both the original Carma and its Splat Pack expansion, launching through the DOSBox emulator. You are given the option of launching with original software graphics, or emulating it in 3DFX Glide, which beautifully renders the models and environment on modern graphics cards. Most of the textures handle modern resolutions well, and using Nvidia's Anti-Alias override (on the DOSBOX exe) smoothes out any minor jaggies remaining. It uses the original CD images of the games, then mounts them virtually. This is not a port, but rather a very good package that lets these classics run out of the box.

Online play appears to be a possibility in this version, with selectable "Launch Carmageddon Multiplayer Host" and "Client" launch options. In practice, it actually does work without any third-party tools, with the host only needing to forward Port 213 in their router. However it has severe desync issues, especially randomly freezing the other car (for one player though) if they separate into another area of the map - which instantly means a desync. This package is provided as-is, so we will have to see if this area is ever improved. It is likely to be a dosbox issue more than Carmageddon itself though.

On the whole, side, front, half, this game is really recommended. Fans of the game should like what they get; it is as close to the original as can be played on modern systems. It is as fun as you remember it. The damage systems and gameplay style have aged fairly well. The physics are arcadey and floaty (in a good way), as you find yourself flying through the air when you ramp off a sign, then somehow land on your wheels. Despite that, you can still keep your wheels straight without randomly losing traction, even at decent speed. For newcomers, I would say the learning curve is not much (stress-relief ya know) and they will enjoy its charm and freedom even with newer car games now available.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZJ_G5-En4yw

author: {'steamid': '76561198029309932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1676199301}
review:
2014:
This game has nostalgia written all over it! I have loved this game since 1997 and still do, I play it on my iPad more now, coz the graphics in it are pretty sweet and much better than the pixelled PC version...

but for those who haven't played it before, BE WARNED, this is NOT a car racing game, this is a destruction game with cars.

P.s : buying carmageddon reincarnation gives you this game for free. that game is prelaunch now, highly recommend buying that...

2023:
Almost A Decade Later, I tried this game and it is now patched (dont know when) to the 3DFX Glide version. So the Graphics is now AWESOME. Its how the iOS version looked but even better. The cars are clear and clean looking. There is no aliasing. the music is great as always! This might have been fixed with 3DFX wrapper long back, but I just re-discovered it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046044358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1405164356}

Its got a massive selection of race areas, and eventually you will have hte massive selection of cars to race with too. I cant wait for the new one to be finished, but this will surly pass the time till then.

Dont forget to splat the flag berarer, $1000 right there!
